Reviews.Title: “Shabby and shady”
Reviews.Author: Jane R
Reviews.Content: I am a loyal member of Hilton honors program. However was shocked by the shabby and dated lobby and rooms. In the lobby bathrooms are kept locked for security reasons, just like a gas station. We found another hotel and left 10 minutes after check in. I will say the manager handled our concerns graciously!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Needs a makeover!”
Reviews.Author: Pamela B
Reviews.Content: Luckily I only stayed here for ONE night! I was placed in a handicapped bedroom, in case you are not sure why I'm complaining...well, the bathroom. Having to stare at the dirty and dingy looking shower chair just grossed me out! Don't get me wrong, the room was clean but the furniture it's just OLD...there was a red spot on the ceiling, it almost looked like blood but I was not able to confirm. Despite the dark colored curtains, they look dirty. There is a Starbucks downstairs but it's useless --it closes at 5:30 PM! The take out options are terrible. I had to go to 2 floors to find water in the vending machines. In some of the floors the vending machines were almost empty. That shows how the management here does not pay attention to the important things. Oh and those towels, super old and rough. I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near theater district and china town”
Reviews.Author: mzqb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Double Tree for 2 nights while in town on business. The hotel location is great - a couple block walk to china town, the theater district, and boston common. There is a T stop right outside the front doors. Tufts medical center is across the street. The room was nice sized and clean - comparable to other Double Trees I have stayed at. Guests can use the attached YMCA for fitness equipment. I worked out one day and they have everything you would want for a good workout. There is a Starbucks in the lobby which I always appreciate. Cabs were frequent outside the front door. Some drunk hotel guests woke me up at 3am one night, but aside from this, I had a restful and relaxing stay. I found this hotel to be more affordable than surrounding hotels in the area. I had to extend my stay one night and the front desk was very accommodating. All of the hotel staff were very friendly and I would definitely stay here again. I would recommend this hotel to business travelers or families who want a nice, affordable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AAA+++ Rating, Don't Hesitate! Book It!”
Reviews.Author: JoeyNewyorks
Reviews.Content: Super clean Tasty cookie at check in You will need a cab to get from this hotel to hotspots Great value compared to other hotels in area. Will stay again Will recommend We are from NY and hold everything to a high standard this hotel met and exceded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: jocesweet
Reviews.Content: The welcome I received at the Doubltree Downtown Boston was quite warm and the staff were all very friendly. The beds are comfortable, as at most Hilton brand hotels. The building, I think, must be rather old because the elevator was tiny! The room could use some updating and new carpet, but other than that is just fine. I wish they didn't charge for WiFi!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: sullynova
Reviews.Content: With help from a deal on priceline, we had an affordable, comfortable stay in downtown Boston for well under $200 per night. Our small family fit into the double room. We enjoyed the co-located YMCA several times over our three day/two night stay. The front desk was helpful in restaurant advice and conquering the Freedom Trail (go to North Station and walk the trail in reverse order). The included breakfast was quite extravagant--we are used to mid-price hotel breakfast bars.

Reviews.Title: “Great, affordable hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sj57
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel with great service! We stayed one night but received exceptional service for an affordable price! Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a cheap night in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Ana P
Reviews.Content: Spent one night and it was very nice. Very spacious and comfy. Big bathroom nice tv big bed!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice convenient location with nice basic rooms.”
Reviews.Author: SubaruLegacy
Reviews.Content: Just spent one night there visiting family. We received a very good rate for a Saturday night stay over (advanced purchase). The room was basic and clean, but you could see where they had to cut corners to fix the wall and such. I didn't pay a lot so I wasn't expecting much. The valet parking rate was very expensive @ $40/ night so I found a different lot that charged $32 that was within walking distance. The check in process was straight forward and the staff was pleasant. I would definitely go back. I didn't give the hotel a perfect score due to the expensive valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Fair Price for a place near alot of action”
Reviews.Author: MScrib
Reviews.Content: This was the 3rd time that i have stayed at the Down Town Double Tree in Boston. It is a really good location. Rooms are nice and clean. Staff is Friendly. Alot of places to eat nearby. The price is Fair. I will defintitely stay there again on my next trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: RachNewcastle
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable and of decent size. The room had fridge, hair dryer, coffee machine and television. There was business centre on the floor which was good for use of computers, printer and internet. There was supposed to be free use of wifi however was unable to work this. The service was good and room was kept clean. The decor appeared dated but hotel appeared clean throughout. The location of the hotel was good with subway on the doorstep. Hotel next to china town and easy walk to theatre district.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Smosh
Reviews.Content: As a Hilton Honors member and a big booster for all of their hotels, I was so disappointed in my stay at this property. Don't get me wrong -- the staff was great and location good but the rooms and property -- not up to par. The building is old fashioned and a bit ragged. Obviously new soft goods (carpets, curtains and such) but the wall paint was worn and the furniture too. The bedroom was large with comfy linens and flat screen TV as one would expect but the bathroom (altho large) had a dinky little free-standing shower of the sort you'd find in an old-fashioned motel or cabin. (It was one of those frosted glass units with yucky looking walls and floor.) I might have forgiven that if the water pressure wasn't so poor -- it took twice as long just to rinse out my hair! I was glad that I was only staying one night. Complained at the front desk and a colleague,staying in another room, complained of the water pressure, too altho at least she had a tub with a shower.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Hilton quality, will stay again !”
Reviews.Author: Ambereye
Reviews.Content: I arrived in the "Red Eyes" flight when I visited my son in Providence; I know I won't be able to sleep in the flight, therefore I have requested an early check in when I made my reservation. I received the e-mail right away from the customer services of Double Tree Hotel. When I arrived Boston on 02/11, it's a very cold day, when I arrvived the hotel around 9:00 A.M. the front desk gave me a warm welcome as Hilton Honor member, and the room is ready for me. The room is spacious, bright and clean, after a hot shower and 2 hours sleep, all my energies back and I am ready to meet my son ! Regardless of the location, a good hotel need to consider the need of their clients, this is much important than anything else. Will stay in this hotel again !

Reviews.Title: “great location; average property”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay57
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel in the theater district, this should be on the top of your list. It was in walking distance to the theaters and numerous restaurants. The property itself was average. Room was comfortable and clean, although the toilet and sink kept clogging/not draining. There is a Starbucks in the lobby, which was convenient. Valet parking was $40 but at least it wasn't a hassle. Breakfast and internet not included, but that's standard with a doubletree. The doubletree guest suites on the other side of town is nicer, but if you're looking for a hotel in the theater district, you can't beat this one.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location, Below Average Service”
Reviews.Author: videoordvd
Reviews.Content: The good: The location of this hotel is superb. It is very close to a T stop, Boston Common, and Chinatown, which made exploring the city a breeze. The size of our room was decent given the price (hotels in Boston tend to be pretty expensive) and had a large bathroom and mini fridge. The accommodations were also very clean. The beds were comfortable but for some reason the bedding was very warm! I had to sleep on top of the sheets. The bad: This is the second time I've stayed at a Doubletree Hotel and I'm noticing a trend that their level of service leaves something to be desired. Upon arriving I was informed that the only parking they had available was "Valet Parking" - essentially paying $40 a day to have a guy drive my car a few yards in a tiny lot adjacent to the hotel. I informed the front desk that I had paid much less to park the last time I stayed in Boston. The staff member rudely insisted that "I must not have stayed Downtown" and said that the cost was reasonable because I was traveling with others and could split it. I drove down the block and parked at a garage for $15 a night. Lying to your customers isn't a fantastic way to start their stay, Doubletree.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Pricing!”
Reviews.Author: AFeist
Reviews.Content: Awesome beds, just as good as the Heavenly beds at the Westin! Lots of pillows of various shapes, perfect for meeting my husband and my needs. No need to travel with a favorite pillow. Nice and quiet rooms, thick walls, I can't hear my neighbors at all! Great Value and Prices on rooms. Loved the Doubletree in Portland also. Clean drinking water in the rooms, thank you!!!!!!!!! I can't tell you how wonderful it was to not have to lug bottles of water up to our room for our 4 night tour of Boston. Cleaning staff was great. Although, I did request, even weeks in advance, a refrigerator for our room and never got it. Good thing the food in the area was so great and affordable that I didn't have to worry about going to a grocery store for healthy food. But it would have been nice if the front desk had delivered it since they said they would when we checked in. Super awesome location, easy to get to everything if your exploring Boston. If you need to eat right away the restaurant is great or the Starbuck's downstairs. But make sure you visit the local coffee shops close by their great (Thinking Cup). Close to the Trolley for tours, close to the T for subway, easy to get a cab. Close to the theater district and Boston Common. We walked everywhere right from the hotel, super cool! Late check out, yummy cookies. Thank you for a wonderful vacation lodging experience. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Boston”
Reviews.Author: ncbiztraveller
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms here for myself and some friends for the Frozen Fenway event. I got a great deal via travelocity - about 120 per night including tax. It was such a good deal I was worried about location or hotel condition. Both were just fine. It is right on the Orange line of the T (Tufts Medical stop is right across street) It is less than a 5 minute walk to Green line (Boylston). It is across the street from Tufts Hospital but did not seem overly noisy. Neighborhood seemed to be safe and well lit at night. Short walk to theaters. Hotel has a dormitory feel about it. It is minimalistic in my view. But the rooms are clean and comfortabel and actually oversized compared to downtown locations. About the only negative is the pricing in the restaurant and there is no dining in the immediate vicinity other than Dunkin Donut or McDonalds. Also no convenient store close by so make sure to have what you need with you. Most rooms do have a mini fridge FYI. I think this hotel provides a tremendous value as compared to similar big name hotels in area. I could find nothing under 200 in the Boston/Cambridge area for similar type hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: sharon71
Reviews.Content: Booked through Virgin Holidays, family of four, 2 adults 2 daughters (16 & 14). Dates; 23-27th Jan 2012. This was our first visit to Boston, the hotel was just what we needed,no frills, basic, friendly, comfortable and clean.location was good, easy to get around. We had a trolly pass for the four days so used that to get around. Nearest stop was stop 6 that was only a 5 min walk. We were up and out by 8am most mornings we were back by 7pm most nights as we were tired after long days. The only night we were out late was when we went to a show. We felt safe walking around, there was an incident going on one evening, however we just crossed the road and carried on walking. Good hotel, good location an amazing historic US city.

Reviews.Title: “Second time we've stayed... would choose them again.”
Reviews.Author: momzpony
Reviews.Content: A few years ago my husband and I stayed here with friends. We were in Boston for a night on the town... nothing extravagant, just dinner and drinks. Since it wasn't a special occasion, we didn't want to pay a lot... just wanted to avoid having anyone drinking and driving. We found the Double Tree to be reasonably priced and in a good location for getting around the city, so we booked it. We were pleasantly surprised to find that it was as good an overnight as we've had in many of the "high-end" Boston hotels. The room was very clean, with a comfortable bed, and a small refrigerator. It's located between the Theater District and Chinatown, so it's convenient for getting around to any neighborhood in the city... public transit nearby and many things to see/do within walking distance. The parking situation isn't ideal, but they do have valet for $40. We were back in the city for the Wine Expo this past weekend and we decided to book the Double Tree again. Once again, the quality of the stay was far greater than the price of the room. The staff was more than pleasant and a big shout out to the valet guys that did a great job cleaning the 4" snow off the car and having it all warmed up and ready for us to just drive away. If you're looking for the 5-star experience, Double Tree might be a let-down... but if you're looking for a great value in the heart of the city... give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “convenience hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tam L
Reviews.Content: we got this hotel from priceline for a decent price. the location was great for us (we did not have a car during our stay). very close to chinatown, within walking distant to the downtown area. it was blistery cold the weekend we were there and managed fine with the walking. the hotel is also across the street from the orange T so that made it very convenience. they welcomed us with warm cookie upon check in, which was a nice gesture. if you only need a place to sleep then this is a great hotel. the only thing we did not like were 2 blue stains on the carpet but it was not a big deal at all.

Reviews.Title: “Superb staff that can really make your trip”
Reviews.Author: MartinDNottingham
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Doubletree for 7 nights over Christmas - I had been following the reviews on here for several months and I have to say I was quite unsure what it was going to be like. I need not have worried . It is a relatively small Hotel - and it's actual design (being inside a former school) does mean that it's not the typical "uniform" style of hotel that you often find - but I didn't come to be housed like a battery hen. Check in was extremely effective and friendly - It was like being welcomed Home. Our room 347 was typical of a hotel that is in an older building (ie not regular shaped) but it was super. Some people would have found the view rather dark ( a canopy and a roof top running track) - but I didn't come to Boston to sit and look out of a window so it was fine. The rest of the room was spot on - The Beds (vital) were excellent, the lined and bedding was first class. We had planty of space, a lovely large TV and the bathroom was more than adequate. The cleaning staff were excellent - extremely friendly and effective. I used the bar twice, on both occassions the service was relaxed and friendly, within a few minutes you found yourself engaged in conversation with the staff and other guests. I had breakfast only once, I'm not a breakfast eater so opted for the continental, It was great and gave me everything and more than I would want to eat - It wasn't the best value breakfast I ate in Boston (as I'm not a big eater) however it was the best . Plenty of people eating the full version seemed to have a great relationship with the chef who was cooking to order. Having a starbucks in the Hotel is a nice bonus - very handy - I would also mention the staff who man the downstairs doors / concierge / parking - who all had a smile and a word whenever you saw them. Finally when my Bro was taken Ill - the front desk and concierge were outstanding in helping us get sorted, Hospitals, missed flights, extra nights in the room added to the mix. Great Hotel,super staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location in proximity to transportation!”
Reviews.Author: THEHIPSTER
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights! First time to Boston. We arrived vary early, our flight got in at 9:30, they were able to accomodate us and get us checked into a room as soon as we arrived. We had booked King but they only had 2 doubles available that early, which was a better fit for my travel companion and I. We were resting in out room by 9:45. The rooms are a little dated, but that is to be expected from a pre-existing building, beds were super comfy, water pressure in the shower was great. Room came with all the extras you expect, fridge, coffee maker, iron, blow dryer. Tv was a good size, when we arrived we were a bit chilled from travel, room heated up in no time. The location to the subway could not have been any better, for never being there and not knowing how to get around the transportation system was amazing and right at outside our door. We were allover the city in seconds. Bill the concierge was absoleutely amazing, we came to town for hockey but booked the trip last minutes and he got us tickets without a worry. We left for our day and when we arrived back they were waiting for us. He was helpful with everything, little tips about the city, things to do etc. Based on that expereience alone, the hotel is more than worth it!! The only trouble we had was the room next too us and down the hall......a bunch of kids who thought thier room was in the hallway. I got up at one point at 2, to tell them to keep it down didn't last long so did have to call security. They arrived, quiet for a minute and as soon as they left, back at it. They tried, but not a good sleep when you have to be up for 4. Warm cookie at check in always a plus, starbucks on site even better. When I plan my next trip I will go back to this hotel. TIP: If coming from the airport skip the 28 dollar cab ride take the free shuttle to the subway, grab the blue line, get off at state and switch to the orange line--forest hills and get off at Tuft Medical Centre when you arrive from underground the hotel is right there. We bought the 7 day pass for 18 bucks and rode the whole time we were there. A one day pass was $9.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: CapeCodTraveler11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I drove into the city for the night to see the Bruins game and this hotel was on sale through Expedia for a good deal. I liked the idea of being so centrally located as we really enjoy walking through and exploring Boston on foot. We arrived at the hotel early and were able to check right in which was nice. I wasn't impressed with the faded and ripped carpet but the check-in process was easy and the staff person was friendly. We were directed to a tiny elevator up to our room. The elevator was very old and dated. The hallway to our room was very worn and the walls were scratched and marked up. Not what I would have expected for a Hilton. Our room was small but the size was fine for my husband and I. The bathroom didn't have a tub, only a stall shower which was disappointing. I've never stayed in a hotel with only a shower. The toilet was slow to flush. The carpet in our room was very stained and I didn't feel comfortable walking barefoot on it. The bed itself was very comfortable but the noise you could hear outside was unbelievable. Most hotels have a unit which helps to drown out the noise and I was really surprised to find that this only had a wall thermostat. There was a fan feature but it did nothing for the noise. Every five minutes there were ambulances going by blaring their sirens. Tufts Medical Center is directly across the street. Finally at about 3am I had to get up and put makeshift toilet paper ear plugs in my ears which only helped slightly. There were people having conversations in the hallway that you could hear as if they were right inside our room. It was really the longest and most tiring hotel experience I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Love the DoubleTree!”
Reviews.Author: Kecia0428
Reviews.Content: Awesome stay! Awesome hotel! Required valet parking threw me off but during my stay I found that parking all over in Boston is expensive so you might as well pay to stay nearcyour hotel... Overall the customer service and the room was great!!! Would definitely stay again!!! P.s the cookies are AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located - Property a little dated”
Reviews.Author: NaPo007
Reviews.Content: In Boston to see the sights, the hotel is conveniently located. T line is just a few steps down from the hotel to get downtown. In theatre district - short walk to the Blue Man Group which was a lot fo fun. Lots of dining options. Room was comfortably large but a little dated. Wash basin and mirror were outside the bathroom, opposite the bed in a carpeted area which I thought was really odd.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: xo2010
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel close to Tufts Medical and this was it. The hotel is directly across the street from the hospital so all we had to do was walk out one door and into the other.I wish they had a shuttle from the airport but oh well it's easy enough to get a cab.It was a short walk to many restaurants .The rooms are clean and spacious. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: amgriffiths
Reviews.Content: A good budget option in Downtown Boston, just next to the Tufts Medical T. Our group requested an early (11am!) check-in and all thirteen rooms were available on check-in, along with complementary cookies. My room was large, clean and comfortable; the bathroom a touch dated but it did the job. The only downsides: breakfast not included, and wifi only at extra cost (though in my part of the hotel there were several free wifi connections available from neighbouring buildings).

Reviews.Title: “Great staff but the hotel needs updating.”
Reviews.Author: ATLtoEUR767
Reviews.Content: The staff was amazingly friendly and helpful from check in until check out. However, I felt the hotel facility itself disappointed me a bit and I was expecting more from a Doubletree. The entry was a small issue for me, being you walk into the main level but you had to take two separate elevators to get to your room (no direct elevator access from the main level to the room level). The hotel was actually two separate buildings molded into one, a newer building which is the front and an older building on the back. My room was located in the older portion and you could hear the creaking floor as soon as you crossed from newer to the older portion, and the noise from the floor wasn't any better in my room. The room was a good size and very clean but it was lacking on style and in need of renovations to replace old fixtures, carpet, fridge, and furniture. The internet worked great in the room for a charge of $12.95 a day per device, so that is $25.90 for the internet on your phone and computer. The location was very close to the Tufts Medical Train stop on the Orange line. Directly outside of the hotel was the Tufts Medical campus which surrounded the Doubletree hotel. It didn't provide for the cosmopolitan city scene some people might me looking for but you can definitely walk to a posh area within 5-10 minutes. The hotel was secure at night and you have to use your room key card to gain access to the lobby. Lucky for me I only paid $70 a night by bidding on Priceline.com. I would stay here again if I got a great bargain but I would not pay the published rates due to the lack of value I saw during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff; good downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beverly F
Reviews.Content: Had a great experience at the Doubletree Downtown during a five-night stay over Thanksgiving. The staff was well trained, extremely helpful and friendly, greeting us each time we entered the hotel. Breakfast was good, although I might have been unhappy if I had had to pay $21 for the buffet. Our breakfast was included as Hilton Gold members. Yes, the hotel could stand some updating and the bar area is a little too small and cramped. But for the money, this is an excellent choice for downtown Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Mainer7
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Doubletree over a recent weekend while attending a convention. Have stayed here before and always found it a convenient location to some excellent eateries (particularly if you like Asian food) and convenient to getting from and to Logan (the airport). The hotel is on the Orange Line (Medical Center stop) and is just a few steps from the T. Easy walk to the Common and other city center points of interest. Also the T is one stop to Boston's main indoor mall - the Copley Center/Prudential Center complex - via the Back Bay Station stop. Only strangeness is the change in the breakfast offering policy for HH members - HH guests used to be welcome to the breakfast buffet, but now are restricted to the 'Continental' items - which are somewhat sparse. Not sure why hotel made this change, as this is not generally consistent with the breakfast offerings at other Hilton properties. Other than this breakfast policy oddity, recommend this property for price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Good corporate hotel”
Reviews.Author: UCLASteve
Reviews.Content: Across the street from Tufts, around the corner from the theater district, walkable but not close to downtown. Comfortable in general; only 6 floors but very long hallways. A renovated parochial boarding school building that contains little of the school except the general layout. Friendly and helpful staff. A few minor maintenance lapses (cracked but functional bathroom sink; room clock alarm set to wrong time but fixed when asked). Next to a full service YMCA with a guest pass for those at the Doubletree. Overall, excellent value for what I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Good option in downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: riossb
Reviews.Content: This DoubleTree is OK, has a very good location literally a few steps away from a T subway station, in Chinatown and not far from the theatre district. The room was fine with a comfortable bed and a large flatscreen TV. We were given a high floor room so noise was not an issue. Room service was good. The HHonors complimentary internet was a bit spotty. Overall the experience was fine, I found the rate very reasonable for what we got and would recommend the hotel if you will be visiting central Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but expensive in my opinion!”
Reviews.Author: jmnteddyLakeCity_FL
Reviews.Content: Pros - This was a great location, close to China Town and not too far to the trolley system. The entire staff was excellent. Free internet and computers and printers were available on each floor. It was great to be able to print our e-tickets for our flights and check email. Cons - Hotel is close to a children's hospital, I heard sirens during the night wasn't sure if it was due to the hospital or not. The beds felt worn. This was just an average room and I feel the hotel rooms, restaurant and bar were very pricey. Although, most places we checked on in Boston were pricey but we needed to be close to public transportation since we did not have a vehicle. Since I spend little time in a room because I'm out seeing the sites I hate to pay a lot for a room. This was my first trip to Boston and I was very impressed with the people, everyone we met was so nice. I hope to return to Boston again and explore more of the city, there is so much history here, just too short of a trip. Our group of 8 all had a great time and feel that Boston is a very friendly and enjoyable city to visit.

Reviews.Title: “VERY VERY EXPENSIVE”
Reviews.Author: Rich H
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree Hotel in Boston is a very nice modern hotel, in a great location. Chinatown is just around the corner as well as many of the city centre sites. Room was clean and spacious, Service was very good. Would have given this place a 4 out of 5 if it wasnâ€™t for the issue with parking. Unfortunately the hotel has a captive audience with regards to parking. After paying $491.34 for our 2 night stay in the hotel, we arrived at the hotel to be greeted by the parking man. He immediately asked if we were hotel guests and if we would like parking. I said we were staying in the hotel and parking would be great to which he said it is $40 per day. This is very expensive and I asked if there was anywhere else to park close by, he said yes there was, but that was also owned by them and had the same price. In summary very nice hotel but with parking and out of high season for 2 nights room only cost us $571.34. you have been warned, very expensive and in my opinion not worth the money, even though it is a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not your usual Doubletree...OK, but not great.”
Reviews.Author: R&G-Opine
Reviews.Content: In full disclosure, I am a Hilton Diamond member 3 times over every year (100+ nights a year in Hilton Properties). This is however, one of the oddest Hilton branded hotels I have stayed in. Hotel appears to be attached to a YMCA and the Tufts medical center. If those facilities are why you are in Boston, then you have found the right spot. If you are there as a tourist, then this isn't the best spot, but is close enough compared to other big cities (about 1 mile to historical center). There is a train right under hotel that can get you to historical downtown in just minutes. Cabs are also plentiful. Big room, but felt oddly like it used to be a hospital room. Things were a bit off from the start. They sent me up an elevator that could not fit more than 4 people (service elevator). Didn't get cookies at check in: not generally worth mentioning, but isn't that the Doubletree "Thing"? The Hotel is in the middle of Chinatown which walking back to feels a little dodgy (but probably is not). I have stayed at Hilton's other premier property in downtown Boston which is fantastic. There may however be a big $ difference so in that case this is not a bad alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: melhojo
Reviews.Content: Being a NYC resident, I'm always inappropriately surprised when hotels in smaller cities are expensive. Finding a hotel in Boston was harder than I expected. That's why when I found a great deal ($158/night) on this hotel in downtown Boston, I was very excited. The hotel's location was fantastic. We were able to walk everywhere -- Fanueil Hall, the Prudential Center, the Freedom Trail, the Seaport District. If we were tired and didn't feel like walking, it was so easy to take the T back to the hotel. The orange line is down the block, and the green line is only about 3 blocks away. I usually hate taking public transportation to the airport, but it was only 6 stops on the T, which makes taking a cab seem absolutely ridiculous. The room was a good size for a hotel in a major city, but it was not very well-maintained. There was evidence of water damage on the ceiling and scuff marks on the walls and bedsham. Still, the room was neat and clean. We did not hear much street noise. We did not use the hotel bar or restaurant because we preferred to be out and about in Boston, but we did have breakfast at the Starbucks one morning, which was very convenient. We did not drive to Boston, so I can't complain about the price of parking. I kind of think that if you insist on bringing a car to a major city, you waive your right to complain about the price of parking. If it upsets you that much, there are plenty of other garages within a short walk if you want to comparison shop. The hotel does not have a gym, but guests can use the adjacent YMCA free of charge. At first I thought this was lame, but once I actually went I was happy to have a whole gym at my disposal rather than some crappy old machines in a tiny cramped room. The people at the YMCA are so nice, it made working out a part of our trip instead of just being something that we had to get out of the way in the morning. The staff at the hotel was very friendly from the moment we checked in to the moment we picked up our bags after spending the day sightseeing after checking out. We were given a chocolate chip walnut cookie at checkin, along with a giftbag for being a Hilton Honors member. Any hotel that charges for WiFi in this day and age automatically loses a rating point. I know tons of hotels still do this, but I just think this is so backwards considering that its almost 2012. We would consider staying here again, but would consider other options as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but facilities in need of refurb”
Reviews.Author: vtnynvvt
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3 nights while attending a convention. My first impression was that the whole building needs an update. Things are looking a little threadbare from the lobby to the guest room. My room was pretty spare and looked out over an empty interior courtyard. The courtyard seemed to amplify all of the exterior noise so not the greatest location if you are a light sleeper. The room was very clean. The neighborhood isn't as bad as some other reviewers made it out to be. It is actually near a T stop, lots of restaurants and the theater district. I walked around alone at night and never felt unsafe. Because it so close to so much, I never had to waste money on a cab. I found the staff at the front desk very friendly and personable. They were able to assist with all of my questions. The concierge had a little difficulty with English so I usually went to the front desk for help. I don't know if I would recommend this hotel but it certainly wasn't the worst experience I have ever had. If I got a really good rate, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great Doubletree experience.”
Reviews.Author: Pilatescutie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old and a bit dark, easily the worst Doubletree that I've stayed in. I was very disappointed to find that I not only received a ground floor room (my profile distinctly indicates I prefer upper floors), but my room doubled as a conference room, having a board table with about 8 chairs. The staff was friendly enough if I could find someone, as that was a challenge. Considering the rate I paid, I could have easily stayed at another property with a much nicer facility. I wouldn't recommend this hotel, too many other nicer places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: Daley61
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel but shadey area. Across the street from ER entrance to Tufts Hospital so alot of traffic and noise. Very expensive to park @40.00 a night! Very congested with traffic at all times however alot of bars and eateries within walking distance. Take a cab instead of renting a car-too crazy to drive.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: Kate O
Reviews.Content: Worst Hotel experience I ever had. It was hard to find, and the hotel employee who we called for directions was unhelpful. We arrived late, and when entering we were greeted by an empty desk in a freezing lobby. After a few minutes, we realized it was the concierge desk. So we carried our stuff up a huge staircase without still seeing an employee. At the top of the stairs, there was a bartender cleaning, we asked for a drink but were told the bar was closed We walked over to the front desk and waited at least 5 minutes without seeing anyone. Finally, a rude guest agent took the time to give us a room. He really seemed as if he'd rather be doing anything else, and had a very phony tone. When we arrived to the room, it was 2 beds instead of one. We were too exhausted to care anymore. The building has a very old feel and the room was just average with no view really. Breakfast was buffet style and average at best, with minimal customer service skills from the wait staff. Dirty tables and empty drinks everywhere. "Refill please?" The location is on the wrong side of the city. In an area formerly known as a combat zone of Boston. Famous for hookers and fights, as well as drug dealing, pan handlers, and murder. Paul Pierce was stabbed across the street. If you are planning on seeing a show on Tremont St. and nothing else in Boston, its ok. Or if you have a family member in the Tufts hospital which is across the street, and the ambulances make that all to obvious. Although, my boyfriend had good intentions, I'd rather stay comfortably home instead.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great service and great locale -- dated bathroom”
Reviews.Author: jag_7896
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for an overnight because we got a great rate -- under $200 for a Friday night. The service was excellent. The front desk was nice and very helpful and the bell staff were great. The hotel is walking distance to almost everything and very near the orange line T at Tufts medical campus. It's also only a 10-minute walk to Downtown Crossing. The hotel is near the Boston Common, theaters, Newbury Street, Washington Street shopping and Chinatown. You can also walk to the North End in about 20 minutes. The rooms are good sized for the city but the bathroom was a bit small and dated -- lots of cultured marble and a small toilet. BUT everything was very clean. If you are in the market for a good location and a clean and comfortable room, I'd check this out. It's not luxurious, but it was a great place for the price. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the location”
Reviews.Author: xJayce
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the beds comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is convieniantely located near a "T" station (subway), allowing us to quickly get to pretty much everywhere we wanted to go pretty quickly. We didn't try the restaurant at the hotel. The only downside I found is the 40$ per pay parking fee. I checked again on Expedia (the site we booked through), and the 40$ per day fee IS listed (I guess we missed it the first time), however there was no mention when we parked that we would be charged until we received the bill at checkout. Overall, a good value compared to other hotels in the area, and would stay again next time in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Sort the restaurant out”
Reviews.Author: DerekHardy
Reviews.Content: This is an ok hotel where we found the reception staff generally very helpful and the room, whilst a little worn, was clean and bed comfortable. The big problem at this hotel was with the over priced and poor quality of food in the restaurant. No ambiance at all and the stale bread rolls didn't help either. Replacement of the sticky carpet would be a good start plus the introduction of restaurant staff training and a new, well presented quality menu helpful. The position of the hotel was good.

Reviews.Title: “Paid near $400 Inc taxes for a night for what?!”
Reviews.Author: C1arkz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night at just over $400 for the night and can only assume that I paid that for the location (which was ok but not fantastic). Has a very tatty and old feel about it ... And the old is not quaint. It's in need of renovation. Rooms were old, grubby carpets, newest thing was probably the tv. I couldn't wait to leave. The service was ok and friendly, but if going to Boston, find somewhere else to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good if you need this location”
Reviews.Author: RIpartisan
Reviews.Content: This hotel provided all the amenities expected. I got a last minute reservation at a busy time at a good price and was grateful. It is not the location I would have liked. Fine if you are going to Tufts Medical Center or Chinatown, but not to close to the locations near the commooooon where I had meetings.

Reviews.Title: “No variety on tv selection”
Reviews.Author: lovespugs
Reviews.Content: Our room with 2 doubles beds was small but adequate. Front desk staff was nice. THe lobby bar is awful and bartender was rude. I asked to watCh a game on espnU and he said cable messed up and no service. When I asked him where I could go watch a game he knew of nowhere, nor did anyone on staff. I finally found a close by pizza place that had espnU and saw my team Win big. I hate that a big hotel like this that caters to tourists offer so few channels and bar amenities. Staff can ve short and rude but that is a Boston thing.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Excellence!”
Reviews.Author: darmarDM
Reviews.Content: We stayed here between the 10th & 13th September and could not fault it. As it was our Anniversary week I dropped a quick e-mail through to Hilton prior to leaving the UK asking for a room upgrade if available. Actually thinking I maybe wasting my time. When we arrived, not only had they upgraded us to a lovely King Room with a great view of the City skyline, there was also a bottle of wine and large plate of Cheese and Crackers waiting for us too. The room was very clean and the bed exceptionally comfortable. Whilst the main corridors are a little tired, the reception is good. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and always on hand for the newbies in town like us. Will certainly return to the Hotel when we go back to Boston. Thanks to all the staff at the Hotel!!!! For those of you who may wonder about Taxi fares from Logan Airport, it cost us $25 + tip

Reviews.Title: “Ups and downs”
Reviews.Author: Supergrannieisgreat
Reviews.Content: A great location but the hotel is tired and worn. really needs a total refurbishment. The majority of the staff were very friendly and helpful and solved irritating problems - like the key card not working when we returned to the room on the second afternoon of our stay and the bathroom door locking when we were outside the bathroom. The guy making the omelets was really lovely, as was the very helpful waiter on our first morning at breakfast and the girl on the desk that helped us with the safe system. The room left a lot to be desired. The windows were filthy and the net curtains not much better. There was no easy chairs to sit on although it was a huge room and space was not a problem. I was surprised there was no safe in the room. Some of the staff were less than helpful. On arrival I asked about the goody bags that some guests were receiving and the girl told me quite offhandedly that they were for Hilton Honours guests but she didn't give me any info on how you became one.Anyway that doesn't matter because in spite of several very positive plus points we won't be returning. I would advise potential guests to check out other options before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Older feeling hotel but great location”
Reviews.Author: BandBCuties
Reviews.Content: Unless you want to pay a fortune any hotel you stay at in Boston is most likely going to have an older feel to it. The hotel lobby seemed newly updated and the room was decent. It is probably the best hotel you will stay at in the price range that it is in. Also the staff was friendly and the location made it an easy walk to most attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, near the "T" stop”
Reviews.Author: Bestmom81
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel for the price. It's location to the "T" stop is what drew us to pick this hotel. Front desk staff & concierge was very helpful in planning our short stay. Rooms are somewhat small we thought for this caliber of Hilton. Free breakfast was only for cold items but, for $5 extra we ordered the hot buffet items. Overall it is a fine hotel for the price in the heart of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for theater district!”
Reviews.Author: BobinOP
Reviews.Content: We saw South Pacific at the Boston Opera House. The walk from the Doubletree takes less than 10 minutes. This hotel has the most economical rates in this part of the city. We paid something like $5 for the chance of up-grading to a high room with a real view of the city, and we lucked out. When we arrived we were told that the fancy room was not occupied and we got it for the $5 we had already paid.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Discerningwon
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel very much. The location is next door to a "T" stop, so is close to everything, if you don't feel like walking. It's about 3 blocks to Boston Common and there are several good, reasonably priced restaurants in the area, known as the Theater District. We were upgraded to a junior suite and except for spotty maid service, everything was first class. The buffet breakfast was included in our rate and it was quite nice. They had the same fruit everyday, but at least they had fresh fruit. There are 2 business centers which were very handy. The front desk was always helpful, and friendly. Bill, the concierge, was a great help and always available. I think you would enjoy this hotel. The only negative is that their bar/restaurant is a bit overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yorkie60
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was quite smart, The rooms were spacious and clean and the staff on the desk were helpful and friendly. Although there was a bar area and a restaurant we didn't use either for breakfast. we brought in preparded fruit and Yogurt and kept it in the fridge ( I hate having to get dressed and go looking for a place to eat) and popped down to starbucks for a morning coffee. We did however have a snack in the bar area the night we arrived, Burgers and chips & salad ( My husband said the grill needed cleaning as his char grilled burger tasted sour).Fairly good area for the shops etc a good walk to the parks and the Cheers bar. We didn't go up the Prudential as it was raining but the shopping was ok. Visited the area around Faneuil Hall - a good place to eat and shop.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, right by the T”
Reviews.Author: newy0rkcitygirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights just to see the sights of Boston, the hotel was clean and very close to the T station. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room. But average lounge and facilities”
Reviews.Author: SiddMoras
Reviews.Content: For the price the doubletree didnt live up to billing. It does have a downtown location. but the backbay and financial district are better locations to stay at. Pros large good room. Not very common in Boston Cons Small lobby. No safe in room $40 parking

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel but the service is not fantastic”
Reviews.Author: HenrikC
Reviews.Content: Had to attend a function in Boston and thought the Double Tree would be a great place. The hotel is located next to China town and just next to a T-station, so convenient for transportation and within easy reach of many downtown locations. The rooms are of good size and have great beds. Very comfortable and comparative large. The TVs are old style and the associated cabinet was not made in this century. The front-desk is efficient and quite knowledgeable. The bell boy is not the fastest person we have seen. The bar and the restaurant has *VERY* slow service. Also the breakfast is of the greasy kind. The selection is not great and it is not healthy. I would go next door to the StarBuck for breakfast next time. The beds are great, and the location is really good. If they could get their service to move a little faster this could be a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff make this a stay to remember”
Reviews.Author: pompeywanderer
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree is located on the outskirts of Chinatown, right by the Tufts Medical Centre Metro station and next door to the YMCA. Ideally located close to Boston Common and the Washington Street shops. We were upgraded to a suite, which had a King size bed and a pull-out bed in the lounge. There was ample space and the suite gave us invaluable space when we were stuck in because of hurricane Irene. Staff were really helpful and accommodating. My criticism would be that with just a small restaurant the dining options in the hotel are limited. There is no pool but guests can use the facilities at the YMCA (pool and gym). Parking onsite is valet only at $40, but Boston is the ideal city for walking, so if you can, forgo the car.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean rooms, updated hotel, friendly employees”
Reviews.Author: Becky8908
Reviews.Content: I couldn't have asked for a better hotel for my stay in Boston. I was with two friends and we were visiting another friend living in Boston. Hotel is in a great location. Easy access to the T (across the street). Got a cab outside very quickly. Tufts Medical Center is across the street too. About a 10 minute walk to the Boston Common (public park). If you keep walking on Boyleston after the park you come to the Prudential Center, which has a ton of shops and an observation deck. Back to the hotel...clean room. Bathroom was spotless. Hallways were quiet. I never heard a peep from another guest. We had a room overlooking the street, but we didn't hear any traffic noise. Check-in was a breeze. We got there right at 3pm and didn't have to wait. Cookies were good (just like everyone says). There are two small rooms, one on the first floor and one on the sixth floor that each have two computers and a printer. We were there during Hurricane Irene and had to rebook flights, so that certainly came in handy. We had vouchers for a free breakfast but didn't use them. I saw plenty of people eating in the restaurant though. There is a Starbucks onsight as well. We checked out a day early because of the storm, but that wasn't a problem. Everything went very smooth.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant staff”
Reviews.Author: marpel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the doubletree for the last night of our visit to New England. When we arrived the booking made by our tour operator had not been received by the hotel and therefore we had no reservation. The check in staff took our details and passed the situation onto Chrisopher who was brilliant - despite not being able to get in touch with Virgin (our tour operator), he honoured the voucher we had and checked us in immediately. The cookies, water and sweets at check in were a great touch, and much needed. We then had problems printing out our boarding passes from the business center in the hotel, again the reception team came to the rescue and had us email the documents to them, which they then printed. In my opinion the staff at this hotel go above and beyond which from a customers perspective is brilliant. I hope the management appreciate their value. The hotel is in a good position, beds are really comfortable and everything works - in my opinion is what most people are looking for from a city hotel. What makes this hotel stand out is the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Smelled Funny - But otherwise Decent”
Reviews.Author: UpscaleButRealistic
Reviews.Content: Got two rooms for a bachelorette party in August, 2011. Great value. Comfy beds! Great view! Rooms come with a mini-fridge. Service was great. Staff very friendly. We got two connecting rooms. Room size good - we slept 8 girls in those two rooms comfortably. Location was good for our purpose (near downtown, waterfront, Chinatown). But, the location is not fabulous if you are out late by yourself - with a group or day time is certainly fine. My only real gripe about the hotel was when I arrived at the room, it smelled like body odor. Visibly clean room. Opened a window and turned on the fan and smell eventually went away.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for quick appt trip”
Reviews.Author: realtimeMaine
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the chance to have a night out in the North End before a day of medical appointments. Taking the T for the first time was easy and we learned a little more about getting around in Boston. Nice staff helped. We had a Starbucks breakfast and a successful day of appointments.

Reviews.Title: “well situated, very good beds, welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: charlotte068
Reviews.Content: this was the only hotel i've found some days before coming to boston. generally i stay in higher category hotels (4*)....but this hotel was a surprise! we arrived late and i had already a restaurant reservation: concierge solved my problem, called restaurant, changed reservation: perfect service. front desk staff was also efficient and very nice. we had a room on 5th floor. standard decoration, very clean and beds were excellent. bed linen, pillows and mattress were really good.... this was all perfect but what i didn't like was the wifi which is not included, so you have to go to starbucks to check rapidly your mail....dommage. we didn't try breakfast, so no comment on that

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmp01
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, kinda spendy and breakfast was spendy. Location was good I thought. Parking expensive $40/night to park right there in the lot. Staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful check in staff”
Reviews.Author: bigblack01
Reviews.Content: Small rooms but a convenient location for exploring downtown Boston. Next door to a Metro transit station. Car parking is expensive at $40 per night but inline with every other hotel in the area. No free wifi unless you are a Hilton Gold member. Reasonable choice around breakfast buffet. If you need a one night reasonable price stop over hotel, this location is fine maybe two nights but as a home from home, not all rooms have kitchenette or lounge area.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, easy walking to Chinatown and Downtown.”
Reviews.Author: pdx_doglover
Reviews.Content: A very nice property with good rates and very convenient. Tufts hospital is right next door as is a T stop. Chinatown is just a block away. I loved the free access to the adjacent YMCA. I enjoyed the olympic size pool that uses saline and not chlorine. As always the cookies are a nice treat at checkin. There is also a Starbucks at ground level. I recommend the Doubletree for business travel and vacation travel due to its high value and excellent location. The one negative is high parking rates. I always skip the car and grab a taxi or the T. I always end up saving money and time.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, Near the China Town”
Reviews.Author: monana66
Reviews.Content: the best thing in this hotel is the nice staff. the rooms are small but there is space for extra bed. the location is not perfect but OK. I didn't like the buffet but we had the choice to have it in starbuks which is located in the hotel. there is no executive lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location, Cookies at the Front Desk, and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Williwillinui
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here with my family. Sure, we had to pay $40.00 for parking, but that is standard if you're staying in a central location in Boston. The entire staff was friendly and helpful. They had delicious cookies at the front desk. There is a restaurant on site, but we opted to go out to Chinatown to eat. From the hotel it was a comfortable walk to many of the parks and historic sites. The hotel is also connected to the YMCA.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it. Would stay again and definitely recommend.”
Reviews.Author: ccdavis
Reviews.Content: I brought my parents to Boston to see the city, but primarily to see Fenway Park. We stayed two nights and have no complaints about the hotel. Our beds and pillows were very comfortable, but best of all the bellman and the parking guys were super friendly and helpful. Very close to the subway, and easy walking distance to the Boston Common. If we everydecide to make the 20 hour trip to Boston again, we will be staying at the DoubleTree by Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful front desk, good location”
Reviews.Author: G8R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is steps away from the subway, so it is very convenient to wherever you want to go in Boston. Half block from Chinatown. Walking distance to Boston Common. Front desk staff always smiled and greeted us as we arrived or left the premises. Starbucks off the lower lobby is a nice touch, but it's not open into the late afternoon. I made an interesting discovery: My wife loves Coca Cola but will not drink a Pepsi. (I already knew that.) So anyway, guess who asks for a Coke? I dutifully walk down to the vending nook, and it has Pepsi but no Coke. I noted the machine takes credit cards as well as cash. So, I went to the next floor to find no beverages in the machine but a very nice selection of candy bars, chips, etc. I couldn't resist, so I bought a Milky Way--haven't had one of those in a couple years. And I was happy to pay for it with a credit card. Next, went to the next floor and found the vending machine had only Coke products. Bingo! But the machine would only take cash. Interesting. Breakfast was included in our room charge. You can get a made-to-order omelet. Nice touch. Waiter one morning said he would bring coffee but never did. We just got it ourselves. Overall a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel; average service”
Reviews.Author: soiepu
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at a convenient location near T, orange line just next door or a little farther, red line, all in walking distance. The room was clean but quite dated. The carpet is old, too. There was a mini-fridge in the room. This is an average hotel; we were not too impressed. The nightly rate was steep but Boston hotels are simply expensive. The service was average -- the staff at the reception and restaurant was not particularly sincere or happy or helpful. There are a lot of hotels in Boston and we will probably try others in the future. Given their rate, we could probably find another hotel that was more friendly and newer.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and nice, no free WiFi though”
Reviews.Author: GrahamBelfast
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of a holiday for one night and it was exactly what you'd expect from this type of hotel, clean rooms/helpful staff etc. One exception is they didn't have free WiFi (they were charging $13 a day!). Given that every other hotel I stayed in in the US had free WiFi I was very surprised, (even the viewing platform in the Prudential tower and the street outside Quincy Market had a free network).

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: mickeymansfield
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights on my first trip to Boston before going on to meet friends in Rhode Island. Staff were efficient, friendly and most helpful, especially the Concierge who went out of his way to give me information. Would highly recommend. A short walk from Beacon Hill, Boston Common and Chinatown and the Historical District. Almost next door to the Tube Station as we call them in England lol!!

Reviews.Title: “The staff was what made the experience great for me”
Reviews.Author: mickeytor
Reviews.Content: I stayed two weekends in July here, and while I was not happy with the price ($240-260 per night) I was still happy with the choice for two reasons. First, the location worked well for me. If your stay includes a trip the Fine Art Museum, the park, the waterfront and the Freedom Trail, you aren't exactly situated next to any of them but rather centrally located enough so that you are near all of them. I walked all over the city and was never really far from home. The second feature for me was the staff. The front desk folks that I dealt with on both weekends were very friendly - and I was impressed that depsite what looked like a busy weekend at the hotel, they actually remembered my name as I passed by occasionally. Their 'welcome' greeting seemed genuine (not scripted) and they were attentive to my needs. I took advantage of the breakfast as well, which was fine, and again, the wait staff were friendly and welcoming. A couple of things that I did not like: A tray from room service sat outside a room for a good 12 hours. One elevator was down on both weekends (a part was on order, so the sign said). The price was a bit steep, but I was checking in during peak season, so staying here again would depend on the rate - but would certainly be a top choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but bad service”
Reviews.Author: ROU22
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great because you are a couple of blocks from Boston Commons, Chinatown, Theater District and Downtown. It is also next to a subway station which is very convenient for visiting places a little farther like Fenway Park, the MFA or Fanuei Hall. But other than location everything is downwards they didn't respect our reservation our airplane got a delay a we arrive late and they have given out our room and there was no more rooms available because of a "pipe problem" they took ages to solve our problem but finally they sent us to the Radisson. One of the two elevators was out of order so it took a while to get up and down from the Lobby to your room. The room was in general quite good and they gave us free internet. But again if you want to grab a snack at night the vending machine in our floor was out of order so you have to walk to other floor to get something or use the elevator that was not out of order. Other detail is the restaurant in which we only ate there once, first is too smal and it get crowded in the mornings for breakfast so we have to wait for around 15 minutes and other days we better decide to go to Au Bon Pain or Mc Donalds just a few steps away. The breakfast in the restaurant was plain and a bit pricy. About 80 dollars for four people and nothing really special. Don't bother in eating lunch or dinner in the hotel, Boston has great places to eat. Overall the hotel was not very good and I was dissapointed because it didn't have the same quality or service as other Doubletree Hotels in other cities. I will definetely not returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel downton Boston”
Reviews.Author: Paolotdr
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in Boston. Spacious room with a large bathroom. Very old, but big, tv set. Great staff at the reception. No free wifi in the room from the hotel, but we could get a good signal coming from outside. The breakfast at the restaurant was quite expensive but there is a Starbucks at the ground floor if you want to save some money.

Reviews.Title: “Good value. Great service”
Reviews.Author: All23Ways
Reviews.Content: Great location next to T stop. Arrived early and our room wasnt quite ready. But the gentleman at the desk offered us an upgraded room on a higher floor with a city view! All the staff were friendly. Very impressed overall

Reviews.Title: “would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: kladuke
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location but we were not impressed with our Junior Suite that we paid to upgrade to. Our Junior suite was not very big I can't imagine what our standard room would have been like. We paid just about the same price to spend a night at the hilton downtown which was much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: jnp3211
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice and a great price for the location. There are a few things that could be updated (such as the TVs mentioned in other reviews) but overall this hotel is clean, comfortable, with friendly staff in a great location (right on the orange and silver line and a short walk to the green). Also, we had no issues iwth noise as stated in other reviews (stay on a high floor facing the courtyard. In addition, the breakfast is very good, although not worth the $20 price tag, but if you can get it included in your rate, it won't disappoint. They also have free business centers throughout the hotel so don't waste your money on the internet charge.

Reviews.Title: “The staff is worthy of a better hotel”
Reviews.Author: pentimento123
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Doubletree for a family weekend in Boston. This is a hotel in need of some improvements. The staff was uniformly courteous, helpful and warm but....the room left much to be desired. Greasy, dirty carpet, patched and stained. Ceiling tiles discolored. A dank smell in the room until we ran the AC. The overal decor was ugly, hallways the color of bandaids, prefab bathrooms, 1980s "modern'. This hotel is in part a renovated school. What a complete miss not to use that to design an exciting city hotel. But if your conscious of budget, I suppose the Hilton chain doesn't think you deserve style.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: WildCommonwealthBoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in July. Staff were very friendly and took care of any needs we had.Good location, beside a hospital and in Chinatown. Room was very quiet and A/C worked great. Short walk to a lot of the sights. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chaz1202
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in jan 2011. Great location everywhere walkable. But subway next door if needed. Staff were incredibly helpful to us, and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AnsonNYC
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel is very friendly and professional and that, for me, makes up for a lot. After all, first impressions are very important. As a diamond Hilton HHonors member, I generally have no problems staying at any Hilton chain property. I booked the cheapest room package from the hotel which included overnight valet parking for only $20.00! I checked in online and took my upgrade to a high floor, there's no executive level here. Plus, who can resist those cookies at check in and whenever you ask for one as well. Between my girlfriend and me, we had about 6 cookies.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay, good location”
Reviews.Author: JetBoys
Reviews.Content: This hotel, in the downtown/Chinatown area of Boston, only has six floors of rooms, but the floors do sprawl a bit in various directions. Some rooms have much nicer views than others. The ground floor has the main and side entrances, a small bell desk, and stairs and an elevator to get to the first floor, where the lobby is located. The first floor has the lobby (with an aquarium), check-in desks, concierge desk, restaurant, and meeting rooms. There are two elevators for guest floors. On my first day, one was broken, but was repaired later that day. After it's repair and tune-up, it was nice and speedy, but the other elevator was extremely slow. My room, a deluxe king, was reasonably-sized with one window, which actually opened (nice to be able to turn off the a/c and have fresh air). The bed is the Hilton Serenity bedding, which is very comfortable. Next to the desk is a small table with Hilton's standard Wolfgang Puck coffee makers, which can make tea if you swing the basket out of the way. I appreciated that the coffee maker was in the main room instead of the bathroom. The room also had a refrigerator (not a mini-bar) which is a nice touch and very handy. The bathroom is small, but with ample counter space. There was no tub (which I don't mind) but rather a small stall shower. The bath amenities are Citron, in my opinion much nicer than Hilton's standard standard Crabtree & Evelyn (which I find way over-perfumed). The building is old, with creaky floors, but the hotel is functional and pleasant. The hotel is conveniently located, a short walk to parks, restaurants, and shops. The front desk staff were unfailingly nice, welcoming and very helpful, always saying "Hi" whenever I walked through the lobby. Hotel guests have free access to the Wang YMCA, which is adjacent. A door on the second floor leads to the YMCA roof and an elevator into the Y. While not fancy, it is functional. The pool is 25 meters by five lanes.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Doubletree/Hilton Standards”
Reviews.Author: QTPyePop
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure (errrrâ€¦more like misfortune) of staying at the Doubletree for a week during June 2011. Let me start off with the good: 1) The staff are extremely friendly. Everyone made it a point to say â€œhelloâ€�, â€œgood morningâ€�, â€œgood nightâ€�, and they did it with a genuine smile. The concierges were awesome! They always opened the door for me and gave me perfect directions when needed. 2) The hotel is adjacent to the Wang YMCA, and as a guest in the hotel you get full access to the YMCA â€“ cardio and weight equipment, pool, basketball court, outdoor track, and even their classes. 3) The â€œDoubletree Bedâ€�â€¦ Doubletree has the most comfortable beds in the hotel industry, in my opinion! 4) The hotel is less than a minute walk from the orange line subway, and itâ€™s also within an easy walking distance to Chinatown, Downtown Crossing, Boylston Street, Back Bay, North End, etc. Okay, now itâ€™s time for the bad/uglyâ€¦ 1) The hotel is in desperate need of a renovation. I mean, DESPERATE need. Iâ€™ve stayed at nicer budget motels and hostels. Doubletreeâ€™s website indicates that the hotel has â€œelegantly appointed guestrooms and suites with an impressive array of in-room amenities.â€� Elegantly appointed? The furniture in our room didnâ€™t even match, and the carpet looked like 80s casino carpet. Everything was old and dingy looking. Impressive array of in-room amenities? Are they referring to their 27-inch tube televisions? Donâ€™t get me wrong, I have no problem with a hotel having tube televisions instead of flat screens, but donâ€™t claim to have â€œelegantly appointedâ€� rooms and â€œimpressive in-roomâ€� amenities. 2) The elevators are soooooooooooo sâ€¦lâ€¦oâ€¦wâ€¦ My room was on the fourth floor, and after the first day I realized that it was easier and quicker to take the stairs. 3) As a Gold Hilton Honors member I was entitled to a free breakfast every morning of my stay. Their complimentary breakfast for HHonors members is quite pathetic. You are only entitled to â€œcoldâ€� items â€“ breads, pastries, fruit, and cereal. If you want anything on the hot breakfast buffet you have to pay $5 extra. I could have stayed at any Hampton Inn or Holiday Inn and gotten a free breakfast WITH hot breakfast items. This is the first Doubletree that Iâ€™ve ever stayed at (and Iâ€™ve stayed at others both domestically and internationally) that doesnâ€™t allow you their full breakfast. What a way to treat your loyal Hilton Honors members! 4) Internet was pretty slow. Would I return? Definitely not.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel friendly helpful staff, clean comforatable room.”
Reviews.Author: barooga
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed this hotel. It was close to everything we needed; subway next door, great shopping a short walk way, plenty of decent restaurants, Macy's very close and very close to Union station which was really handy for us as we trained it with Amtrak, from New York and then again to Washington. Staff were very friendly, helpful and welcoming and the choc chip cookies were a definite bonus. (they keep them in a heated drawer and hand them out when you register and again whenever you come back into the hotel, if you ask. (which I did. Lots!!!) the room was a good size, quiet with a decent shower and the bed was terrific. There is a Starbucks on the ground floor of the hotel as well with free wi fi. There are no tea or coffee making facilities in the rooms (seems to be the norm in America) but we were forewarned and took a travelling electric jug with us, and our own tea bags. (Gotta have a cuppa first thing in the morning and last at night!) We loved Boston, it's a great place to get around and we'd thoroughly reccommend the 'duck tours' - novel way of seeing a city by both road and water and the tour guide was very knowledgeable and amusing. Learnt a lot about Boston, it's history and heard anecotes about buildings, cemetaries, statues etc. We also used the Greyline double decker bus tours. Pay for two days and get on and off wherever you like, whenever you like. Great way to see a City and learn about it's history and secrets. (we'd used this tour company in New York as well and later in San Francisco, probably the best of any of those kinds of tours). We also felt comfortable using the subway and did so often. It's an easy system to use, cheap and efficient. Harvard was amazing. Always wanted to go there and it was as I imagined - beautiful old buildings that just reek of history and the famous people who studied there over the centuries. Shopping is good, restaurants were excellent and it's a beautiful city with the gas lights and all the different churches giving it a lovely feel. It reminded me a little bit of Melbourne. Would stay at this hotel again. If you want professional, friendly staff, a comfortable room and bed and to be central to all the major tourist attractions and restaurant and shopping precincts, all at a reasonable price, then this is the perfect place!

Reviews.Title: “Theatre district, parkour heaven, the boys loved it”
Reviews.Author: Yoriyee
Reviews.Content: Taking two 14-year-old boys to Boston brought the challenge of where to stay. We stumbled across this Doubletree and are so glad we did! It's right around the corner from the theatre district, a quick walk to the Common, near a ton of affordable restaurants and shares facilities with the immediately adjacent YMCA. The boys are very much into Parkour and were thrilled to see the setting of a Parkour YouTube video right outside our window. The subway stop is right next to the hotel for our trips to Harvard Square, Boston Harbor, the Aquarium, Freedom Trail, etc. But if you ask them what the best part was..it was how welcome they felt by the staff. Every time they popped over to the front desk they were greeted with smiles and an endless supply of warm chocolate cookies. One suggestion to save money is that we cancelled our rental car when we found out parking was $14 a day. We never regretted it. Boston isn't that large and there were subways and taxis everywhere we wanted to go.

Reviews.Title: “Met my needs - good location”
Reviews.Author: mpgermany
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night while visiting Boston. I picked the hotel because it was near a subway station and walking distance to Boston Common park area. Check-in was easy, rooms were clean and bed was comfortable. Only issue was sleeping - noise from truck traffic was bearable, but I prefer quieter. Had continental breakfast in the morning, but as a diamond member, I upgraded to the full buffet which I thought was very good - even had cook to order eggs. This was my first experience with a vending machine that only takes credit cards - I didn't even know such a thing existed. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: kdchoonoo
Reviews.Content: Room and bed were nice enough. Pillows were awful. Before falling asleep you could count on the pillow being completely flat. Housekeeping was extremely stingy with the washclothes. After requesting extras we were only given one more. Location was great. Get off the T and the hotel is right there. Convenient when hauling luggage. But I wouldnt stay here again if I had a choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wicked Good Deal in The Hub”
Reviews.Author: WRC6
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I was reluctant to book this place at first due its relatively low ranking on Tripadvisor. But out of convenience and with a great discount rate, I took the plunge and have absolutely no regrets. WHAT WAS GOOD: As all the other reviewers seem to agree, the location is excellent. You can cover much of Downtown Boston on foot or catch the â€˜Tâ€™ just steps from the doorâ€¦.Every member of the staff I came in contact with was exceptionally pleasant and accommodatingâ€¦.The breakfast buffet was EXCELLENT. I donâ€™t get some of the negative comments from other reviewersâ€¦.My room had a good amount of floor space for an urban hotelâ€¦.I had a pretty nice view of the skyline of the Back Bay, even from my (relatively low) third floor room. WHAT COULD HAVE BEEN BETTER: In-room wireless (for a fee) was extremely hit or miss. My connection got dropped constantlyâ€¦.I hate to belabor this or to parrot other reviewersâ€™ comments but there really does seem to be an issue with parking lot noise in the early morning hours. Even in my city-facing room (away from the parking lot) I was awaken one night. (Iâ€™d also note that it only happened on one of my three nights here, so itâ€™s probably not a nightly occurrence.)â€¦.Youâ€™ll notice a slight bit of mileage in the room interiors (bathroom ceiling, wallpaper, carpet, etc.) but Iâ€™d emphasize that everything is spotlessly clean and in good working order. No real issue there unless youâ€™re extremely picky. THINGS TO KNOW: Rooms still have the old tube style TVs as of this writingâ€¦.They also have small refrigerators and in-room coffee machinesâ€¦.My room had a shower stall only, no tubâ€¦.Thereâ€™s an unlimited number of dining options within a block or two of the hotelâ€¦.Parking is valet only, no self-park. BOTTOM LINE: Yes, there are a couple minor things that might irritate exceptionally picky travelers, but when you factor in service, location and price, in what is one of the most ridiculously overpriced hotel markets in the US, this one is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough, but dreadful internet connection”
Reviews.Author: MatthewBooth
Reviews.Content: This is an average quality business hotel. Everything's there and it's clean. I found the service to be above average. However, the internet connection available is diabolical. They charge $13/day for 'highspeed' internet. They don't tell you that it's explicitly capped to 1Mb/s, that they intentionally mess with Skype so it can't be used, and that even that 1Mb/s isn't guaranteed or always achievable. That last point means that even switching from Skype to our corporate SIP didn't result in usable call quality. Downloading a large file from the office isn't fast either, as the connection speed tanks every few seconds. This terrible performance was consistent throughout the entire week of my stay, so wasn't caused by any temporary issue. It was also unrelated to wireless performance as it was reproducible anywhere in the hotel I tried. Being stiffed by this type of hotel for internet charges is par for the course, but bad service is inexcusable.
