The last time I came to Boston I stayed in a nice little B&B in Cambridge which provided an excellent connection... for free. As Doubletree's connection is outsourced I expect this is common to all Doubletree hotels in the US, and possibly other Hilton brands too. Having a good internet connection is very important to me while I'm away, so I'm not inclined to stay at any Doubletree in the US in the near future. I should have stayed at the B&B in Cambridge again.

Reviews.Title: “unfair treatment”
Reviews.Author: Corrado76
Reviews.Content: we were 3 friends, booked (AND PAID) the hotel 1 month in advance and specifically requested a suite with 2 rooms, one with a King size bed and one with a pull-out sofa bed. one of us snores heavily so we wanted to make sure he was isolated.we get there at midnight and the concierge does not mention a thing to us, just welcomes us, acts friendly, gives us the keys and when we go up in the room, we find out it is a single room with 2 double beds (not even Queen). so we go back down immediately and say it is not the room we requested and paid for in advance.the concierge admits we are right without even looking at our reservation papers (so why didn't you say a word about it when you checked us in??) but says that's the only room they had available. so it was that room or no room.we didn't want to uselessly argue further but we did not accept to pay that price for that room, so we came to an agreement and they waived off the $40 fee for the parking. still not a good service. Other than that hotel is fine, a good 3-star, certainly not a 4 star hotel. I would not recommend it though.

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable, convenient”
Reviews.Author: savvyseniors
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable hotel, with a better than average free breakfast, including omelets cooked to your taste. Right next to the medical center and Boston Floating hospital. One T stop from Chinatown (or easy walking). Friendly, helpful staff. Warm chocolate chip cookies on arrival. Only complaint: you have to pay for internet in the room. Used an internet special to get a room high up with a city view.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: LondonLove330
Reviews.Content: Pros: -friendly staff -chocolate chip cookie on arrival -beds were comfortable -room was clean -rates were somewhat decent for being in town Cons: -charged extra for a "high" floor. Didn't realize before booking that there were only 6 floors. -Front desk staff gave us wrong/unclear directions TWICE. When trying to get to Symphony Hall, someone told us we were at Heath (she even circled it on the map saying "we are here") and had to take the green line toward Lechmere. We were actually at Boylston and had to take the E line TOWARD Heath. The second time was a different employee who tried to get us to the airport. She didn't tell us that the Silver Line was a bus stop, so we went down into the Orange line station at NE Medical Center (thinking silver was down there somewhere too), and a T employee just told us to take orange, transfer to red, then take SL 1 at South Station. -There was definitely a large, loud crowd outside in the middle of the night during our stay. It woke us up and it was very hard to go back to sleep. We did not call the front desk about it and it's not the hotel's fault...but police need to be present on those nights for being drunk in public and disturbing peace or else the hotel is going to lose business. No one likes to be woken up in the middle of the night, especially before/after a long day of traveling or sightseeing. -The restaurant was overpriced and not even good. My clam chowder almost tasted sour and watery and didn't have any potatoes. The pizza had a weird taste to it. I might stay here again and recommend this hotel only for the clean rooms, convenience to the Boylston (NOT Heath!!!) station, and Dunkin Donuts. I would not eat at the restaurant again. I would be wary of directions given by the front desk staff and the weekend noise at night.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, But Be Prepared For A 2:00AM Wake Up Call”
Reviews.Author: mxh202
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend trip to Boston and I stayed at this DoubleTree. This was the second time I stayed there and the 4th time for my wife. This is a decent hotel, although a little dated. The beds are comfortable and the room size is decent. The staff for the most part is very friendly an accommodating. I never ate in the small restaurant, but there is a Starbucks that you can access through the lobby. Coffee and muffins for two will run about $8.00 a day. Now for the negative.........If you stay at this hotel, DO NOT, I repeat DO NOT stay in a room on the north side of the hotel! Especially if it is the weekend. On the north side of the hotel is a large parking lot that is not part of the hotel. When the area bars close at 2:00am the parking lot becomes a loud and obnoxious drunkfest. The first night we stayed there, from 1:50 - 2:30 there was loud yelling and screaming that eventually turned into a fist fight. The second night at 2:00am extremely loud music woke us up. When I looked out the window a vehicle had its sound system cranked and there was a large crowd dancing in the parking lot around the vehicle. After about 10 minutes I called the front desk and asked if they were going to do something about it. They said they would send security to check it out. I never saw anyone go out and try and stop the crowd. The acoustics of the surrounding buildings send the sound straight up, and although we were on the 5th floor it sounded like the crowd was right outside my window. Again, it's not a bad hotel. The only problem I had was the drunks at 2:00am. The hotel needs to get Boston PD to stage a car in the parking lot and pop people for DUI, and drunk and disorderly in public.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay, good location, forget breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Kisanunda
Reviews.Content: The hotel is older, needs a fresh look and renovation. Still nice comfy hilton bed. Breakfast is blah, don't pay the $20 not worth it. Great access to the orange line, easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the rooms facing the parking lot”
Reviews.Author: calster
Reviews.Content: Overall, this was a very nice hotel. The staff were very friendly and the gym is the YMCA that is connected by a walkway and elevator to the hotel. The room was functional. Unfortunately, the suites are at the end of the hall and are next to a public parking lot. When the W hotel's bar closes, the partying begins. Car stereos were blasting and generally, a boisterous crowd is having a bunch of fun. Unfortunately, that translates to interrupted sleep. I had read the reviews about this in the previous posts, but even ear plugs were not enough to muffle the sounds. Otherwise, I really liked the hotel. The location is fantastic. It's easy to get around from here. I would stay again, but definitely in a room away from the parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par”
Reviews.Author: NYC7
Reviews.Content: I stay in all types of Hiltons around the world and wouldn't return to this Doubletree, as a Diamond level client. The hotel is in good shape but for the price, stay at the Hilton in Back Bay. What disappointed me most was the breakfast, which is a minor thing but when you're in a location for business, pretty much why I choose a Hilton brand hotel is for a room choice, and a good breakfast. At breakfast, the staff was hard to find and the buffet breakfast lacked in so many areas. The oatmeal was so thin with water that I could hardly eat it, but I managed after I had to get up to find a server to ask for a soup spoon, and that was like passing an act in Congress (for the server had no idea of what I was describing, and had to ask 3 colleagues as to where she could find a big spoon) - most Hilton brand hotels automatically place a soup spoon next to cereal & outmail, even if it's a plastic spoon at a Hampon Inn. Then it came to the unripe fruit and the horrible fake youghurt (some "light" brand that's I literally couldn't choke down, and I eat youghurt every day). Lastly, I was never offered coffee - I'll stop here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Downtown”
Reviews.Author: mac52_11
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a long drive through a snow storm & were greeted with genuinely friendly staff at both concereige and front desk. Delicious warm cookies were handed over and were very welcomed after our long drive. The rooms were extremely comfortable, clean and beds were great. The breakfast served in the restaurant was very good and set us up for the day. Fresh Waffles and Omelets were made to order and were delicious. Taxi's were easily hailed outside. Staff extremely helpful and courteous. Overall, good value for money but had to pay for wi-fi access.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: newhampshire5
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights. We specifically called the hotel before booking to make sure that they had a pool and that it was open at night. We were told "yes". We got to the hotel around 6pm and went right to the pool. You have to walk across the roof top on the 2nd level and enter the YMCA that adjoins the hotel. It was freezing and the pool was dirty. Noone under 18 is allowed to use the hot tub which was gross anyway. When we got back to our room we ordered room service. The food was excellent and the quality was great although it was very expensive. The second night after having a day out, we went to go to the pool. It was about 7pm and it was closed! The kids were very disappointed as were we since we had specifically asked when we made the reservation. The room was fine. We had asked for adjoining rooms with 2 queen beds but got king beds. Luckily the kids didn't mind sharing.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to Believe This is a Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: Indiofan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Feb 25 and Feb 26, 2011 with my family. First night we upgraded to a "King Suite" so that my husband and I could have the bedroom and my teenage daughter and niece could have the pull out at night and yet still have space in the suite during the day. We get to the "Suite" only to find out that the sofa sleeper was missing and in its place was a mini loveseat. I called front desk who told me there were no other rooms but that they would send me up 2 roll aways. Once the roll aways were brought in there was no room to move around in that room. Room is outdated - rugs are stained and pieces have been cut out and replaced, bathroom has water stains on ceiling, and tables have chipping paint. Also, the room overlooks a parking lot and at around 2:00am we were suddenly awoken to the noise of a huge brawl in the lot. I called front desk to complain and they assured me they would take care of it, but this went on for at least 45 minutes. The second day I had us changed to 2 double bed rooms which I admit was a better room. I can keep going with this review, but I'm sure you get the picture. Oh, the pool is actually next door in the YMCA. You have to leave the building and go through a walkway outdoors to get to the pool. Not ideal in Feb. freezing temperatures. Oh, and parking is $40 a night!

Reviews.Title: “Loudest hotel ever been to.”
Reviews.Author: Trvlvt
Reviews.Content: We had reserved a suite room so that we would have a pull-out for the kids. When we got to the room, the pullout was broken, and in it's place was a loveseat-no pullout. Our room looked out onto a parking lot that became a party central at night, it didn't break up until 3 am. Also had trouble getting billed for the roll away that they offered to us.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Place to Stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: SirNigelC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in October 2010. We found it a very comfortable and convenient base. The breakfast are very filling and the staff are friendly. We had one evening meal at the bar - just burgers etc but very good quality. The staff were all very polite and helpful. There was no free wifi that I could pick up anywhere but if you sit upstairs near the front of the bar area you can connect to the public wifi at the hospital across the road. There is a handy little Starbucks attached to the hotel. I'd go back here. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful customer service”
Reviews.Author: lbast2010
Reviews.Content: I am a long-time and loyal Doubletree customer and have stayed at their locations in a number of cities across the country. In my experience, the service has been very good, the rooms decent, and the prices fair. I expected the same thing at the Doubletree Downtown Boston when I was in town on a business trip in January 2011. I was deeply disappointed. To make a long story short: I was told that I would be charged one price during my stay but was in fact charged another that was significantly higher. Hotel management politely dismissed my concerns and insisted that I had to pay the higher price. Subsequent attempts to resolve the situation after the fact have proven futile. I am deeply frustrated by Doubletree's unwillingness to listen to my concerns or to resolve the situation. There is no way I can stay with Doubletree again, especially at this location, given my experience.

Reviews.Title: “SUPER FRIENDLY!!!!”
Reviews.Author: redchair28
Reviews.Content: LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS HOTEL!! I arrived in Boston on Friday January 7th. This is my second time at the hotel, the first time I went to Tufts and didnâ€™t explore the city at all. I came here for my friends wedding but decided to make the stay longer to check out Boston. When I arrived (drove because I live in CT) valet looked like they were waiting for my arrival, they were so welcoming! I arrived a few hours before check in but thatâ€™s ok because the bellman stored our luggage for free. The front desk workers were extremely friendly and gave me so many ideas of what to do nearby: restaurants, theaters, bars, and lots of Boston-y type things like the Freedom Trail walk and Duck tours. It was freezing out that day but everything was nice and close and walking distance from the hotel, it is also located right next to the train station. I went to some very nearby bars; I highly recommend The Liquor Store and Gypsy Bar. For restaurants, Fire and Ice was so fun and the Melting Pot. There were lots of places to grab dessert late at night too. A fun place to go is Jacques Cabaret - Google it! â€¦also caught a show of the Rocketts! My last visit, I asked the feathered pillows were taken out due to my allergy, when I got into my room there was a not explaining why the pillows were not in the room. That was so cool that they actually noted that for the next visit so I didnâ€™t even have to even ask! The rooms were super clean and spacious, the beds were like heaven!!!! The best partâ€¦Starbucks right in the hotel!!!!! Free internet in there too!!! I highly recommend this hotel!! I canâ€™t wait for our next Boston weekend!!! So much still to do and see!!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK, noisy room...and where is my cookie?”
Reviews.Author: srauhala
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night as a cheaper alternative to the hotel my wife's holiday party was at. I got the hotel for about $95 after taxes/fees on Hotwire. We checked-in with no problems at about 3:30 on a Sat. They were nice at check-in but where was my cookie? Is it because we booked through Hotwire? Not a huge deal but I always thought the cookie was a nice touch...if you get one. Our room was in the back corner on the 4th floor. We did not get asked for a bed preference and ended up with 2 full size beds. Not a big deal again but we would have preferred a King or a Queen. The room was clean which was the most important thing but it could use a couple updates such as a flat screen TV. I thought the bed was very comfortable but my wife said she did not sleep well. Also, as what seems to be a increasing trend in hotels there was no electronic safe. Other than that the room was a pretty standard hotel room. One of the two big negatives was it was pretty noisy. For a change I heard no hall noise, or much from the hospital next door, but you could hear a lot of other outside noise. We were on the 4th floor and you could hear people talking on the sidewalk! You couldn't hear what they were saying but I could hear them while I was laying in bed. Also, the city was clearing the sidewalks from a dusting of snow the night before and you would have thought we were on the bottom floor, not the 4th. It was really loud, enough to wake me up and I am a pretty sound sleeper. The other negative was the room thermostat was the old knob style that didn't seem accurate. The room was very warm even when it was turned down. We did not visit the restaurant, bar, or any other facilities so I cannot comment on that. The location of the hotel is pretty decent, it is just over a block from the theater district so it is convenient. There are a couple T stops right there and several restaurants in that area. No complaints there and it would be a good for those with 'good location' up near the top of their list of hotel requirements. So overall it was not terrible but it could be better. A few upgrades and better soundproof windows and I would rate it higher. Until then I am not sure if I can totally recommend it, especially if you are staying more than a night.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable night out in beantown”
Reviews.Author: UmassHotelier05
Reviews.Content: I live outside of Boston and decided to have a nice romantic night out in Boston before the New Years rush. We chose the Doubletree downtown because of its location and its proximity to the public transporation. The setting was not exactly Romantic as it is located right across the street from a hospital. The pool and gym were inside the Chinatown YMCA.. so our relaxtion time in the hot tub was a bit noisy. But the hotel was comfortable and satisfied our basic needs.. We were expecting a bath tub in the room but our King room did not have one.. we made due with the stand up shower. The tvs seem a bit outdated.. but it was not the purpose of our trip. The front desk agent that assisted us we very warm and welcoming. I would recommend the hotel for people traveling to the city without a car, that want to explore the Boston area.

Reviews.Title: “Small room with good facilities”
Reviews.Author: Sridharan K
Reviews.Content: The room is very small. Very costly. Breakfast is not free and adequate. Internet also is not free. Location is good. You can sleep well as the bedding is fine. Friendly staff and manager. Over all good to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quality, value, convenience”
Reviews.Author: dailymails
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location,Close enough to attractions without the high prices of some of the other hotels.Great service. Would stay at the same place if we ever go to boston again.Highly recommend the place

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful spot in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Cunningham19
Reviews.Content: I went to Boston for an interview. The hotel was in a great location, lots of restaurants and shopping close by. Great service. Highly recommend the place.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: mamaparkerd
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Doubletree Boston Downtown and was pleasantly surprised at the friendly and helpful service. The location was great for us. Didn't use the subway, just walked the Freedom Trail from the hotel. Close enough to attractions without the high prices of some of the other hotels. Restaurant staff were extremely helpful and pleasant. Would definitely recommend and will stay again if ever in the area again. Parking was a little high but it is Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant & accomodating staff, easy access to sites, clean - a welcome relief!”
Reviews.Author: happytohelp1
Reviews.Content: After reading some negative reviews on this hotel, I was immediately relieved when we walked in the door. The staff graciously stored our luggage so we could begin touring Boston for several hours before check-in and then, the entire next day (as our flight was leaving in the evening). Just a quick walk to the T Orange line, Chinatown and Boston Common! Had an inside room (no noise) and never saw the homeless mentioned. The hotel is older, as most in Boston are - but it was clean, beds and pillows comfortable, w/ attention paid to housekeeping details. Kudos to our night manager Hamed for his friendly attitude and restaurant recommendation in Chinatown, and to our wait staff at Sunday's breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Attitude!”
Reviews.Author: purple2
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here before many times and the staff has been inconsistent. We love the location in Chinatown and access to the trains. Pleasantly surprised that new desk management and wait staff are so friendly and they really seem to enjoy working there now! What a difference. Definitely would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “decent location, nice staff, and clean”
Reviews.Author: lilybelle344
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here recently. The best thing about this hotel is it is about a 5 - 10 minute walk to Boston Common, the public gardens, and the wonderful restaurants and shopping along Boylston and Newbury Ave. The room was clean and large. The staff were all kind and helpful. (A nice cook even went back in the kitchen and made me an egg sandwich late one morning while I waited at the bar.) If you want to visit the North End for dinner, it would probably be best to take the T. On the downside (minor, in my opinion) the hotel is located near a hospital. You may hear some ambulances, but the drivers seemed to cut out the sirens as they approached the e.r. entrance. Not sure if I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, homeless neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Soleil060
Reviews.Content: I would recommend if you are ready to take taxis after 7pm. Very good if you want to use the T which is very friendly user and Bostonians are willing to help you find your way. We did not use any of their facilities. Very good CafÃ© at the Tuft Medical Cente Au bon pain open 24h - all goods offered are healthy and not expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, bad location”
Reviews.Author: just4funNebr
Reviews.Content: It's the high quality you expect from Doubletree. No surprise there. The surprise was that for a hotel with this name, I didn't expect homeless people outside next to the medical center. You had to walk five blocks to get to a restaurant. (There is one in the hotel but it is very small and food selection was low.) Good news is that if you chose to take a cab, you could skip the beggars, homeless, and 1/2 mile walk for about $6. The hotel did what I needed it to do but I want others to be aware of it's location.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: CkBrown2
Reviews.Content: Julia was one of the kindest receptionists at the hotel. Very knowledgeable and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Mar_char2798
Reviews.Content: 1st off, could not find luggage rack to move baggage from parking lot. 2nd ..when we got in the room there was a used facecloth that had not been removed from shower ...Yuk! 3rd ...windows on 5th floor room opened wide enough that an adult could easily climb thro' ..a child would have no problem, very unsafe condition caused by broken safety chains ...they were fixed fairly quickly and we were compensated with 2 free water bottles and 2 complementary breakfasts ... we used them the next am but the waitress spilled coffee on the table in front of me and made no attempt to clean up. The breakfast buffet was less than fresh and we didn't eat there again. 4th ...the $12+/day internet was at best flakey ...yes $12+/day. We have submitted a formal complain and after 4 days no response ...is this enough?

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: Taste4More
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a long weekend in Boston with his parents. This hotel was very accomodating and in a great location. It is located right next to the Orange Line with easy access to downtown and Haymarket area. The staff was very kind, in particular the maids jumped in to assist us when we were having trouble with our key. They made a point to call the front desk from a nearby room to get us assistance which was very appreciated. The only downside, we had a lovely suite, but it bordered a parking lot that held a lot of nearby bar traffic from the Courtyard Marriott. Every night at 2AM we had to listen to the drunks coming out and yelling. But, I would simply ask for a room in another location, and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate”
Reviews.Author: braidmacd
Reviews.Content: It is within walking distance to most of the city, plus there is a subway stop next door. This fit the bill for us of an â€œOKâ€� hotel downtown for less than $200. Nice breakfast and the staff is very friendly. Our standard room was very comfortable and well sized. At less than $200 for right downtown, the value was there. If you are into fun restaurants/bars check out the Jacob Wirth German restaurant around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lookingglass101
Reviews.Content: Pros: Walking distance to freedom trail/fanieul hall/Boston Common (about 20 mins or short cab ride) Right next to T stop (orange line) Across the street from Tufts Clean and comfortable rooms and friendly staff Access to YMCA Decent Breakfast Cons: Couldn't find any resturants/bars right by hotel but walking to faniel hall was ok. No self park (valet was 40 dollars a day) We were in boston for a guys weekend, this hotel was close enough to everything and public transportation for us and was a decent price. Rooms were big enough for 4 people and were clean. Overall I would reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JinxyYork
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews before I left Uk I had mixed feelings of what to expect. On arrival we received the lovely warm cookie as expected, though the hotel failed to hold a family room which was booked almost 10 months ago and provided a stow away bed instead. To compensate they gave us complimentary continental breakfast, though I'm glad I didn't pay for it as it was the worst selection of continental breakfast I have had and would have grudged paying the full price. However, this was the only critisism of the hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel advertised it was having a make over, though there was no disruption to any of the areas we went to. The rooms were very clean and the bed was very comfortable. It was centrally located in the theatre district and it only took 10 minute walk to get to Boston Common, Back Bay and Downtown areas and is 20 minutes walk from South Station. I would definately ignore some negative aspects of the reviews, certainly about hearing sirens all night, as we never heard a thing. I am unable to comment on the leisure facilities as we were too exhausted from our daily outings. There are some good restaurants nearby, which are worth a visit: Jacob Wirth and Rock Bottom and there was also an italian not too far away (though I can't remember the name). We would definately re-visit this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel; excellent service”
Reviews.Author: MMike_7
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. Nice room with all amenities and staff very helpful indeed. Very handy for the T transportation system and nearby restaurants and shops. We did not eat in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: vickyhr
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. We were able to check in early when we got there. We ended up getting their special cookies at check-in as well as free breakfast since we were Hilton Gold Honors members. Our room was on the 4th floor, and it was nice and big with a great view of the skyline. I found the service to be excellent and the location was really close to everything. We thought it would be loud because it is right outside the NE Medical Center, but we heard no outside noises the whole time we were there. Also, there is an orange line stop right next to the hotel which was so convenient for my boyfriend and I. It was also very close walking distance to Boston Common, lots of restaurants, and shopping. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good base to explore”
Reviews.Author: Rich224
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in a good location, easy to walk to Boston Common.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: dre_techie
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here for one night, but service was good and it's a very convenient location to the Theater District, you can even walk down to Prudential Center if the weather is good. Although this isn't a very new hotel as the lobby and the rooms show, everything looked clean and the staff was helpful. The on-site Starbucks offers a good alternative if you don't want a full breakfast. Free internet is available in the lobby, I just had to ask the front desk for a username/password.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: OrionSouthEngland
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at a Double Tree Hotel as we were unable to get a room at the Hilton, Boston. The hotel is conveniently located to either walk or take the metro to all the downtown tourist areas. The building is quite new and in good decorative order throughout - no nasty surprises. The reception staff were excellent on arrival and gave us plenty of local information and helpful advice responding to all our endless questions. We were then given delicious warm cookies to take to our room. The room was of a high standard and good size for the price and the bathroom was equipped with essential toiletries. The only reservation was that the shower could have been more powerful but otherwise we were pleasantly surprised. The bed was comfortable although we had to change the duvet over for a lighter and cooler blanket. Plenty of pillows were supplied and the mattress was comfotable. Breakfast was included in our room rate. There was a good selection of hot dishes as well as an omelette bar. All in all a great place to stay and see this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Tarnished Reputation - a MUST READ”
Reviews.Author: HHDiamondMember
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Hilton properties over the years; as they are my first choice of Hotels when I travel for business or pleasure. The Doubletree Downtown Boston (Chinatown) was listed as a category 6 property. Maybe when it was first built and considering the location made this a category 6. To be fair, today I would rate this hotel a category 3 by Hilton standards. The Elevators, Lobby, and condition of the rooms are less than par. The mattress in my room was not the same comfortable mattress I am familiar with at other Hilton and Doubletree Hotels. This mattress was not plush or comfortable. I woke up with a backache. There is a large parking garage next to the Hotel. It belongs to the Hospital. There was a car alarm going over several times during my two night stay. Also the Ambulance Sirens were annoying at times. Otherwise the Hotel was quiet. Most of the Hotel including the guest rooms come equipped with a Drop Ceiling. I climbed onto the bathroom vanity and peeked up into the ceiling to see what was up there as I was concerned about SECURITY. From what I can tell a single piece of drywall was seperating me and the next room. This made me a bit uncomfortable as I could imagine any LUNATIC crawling over the wall in the middle of the night. If this is the case I am not sure how this hotel got away with that in regards to code. The staff were pleasant and friendly. However, I would not stay at this property again. Try one of the other HIltons in town or the Colonnade, Liberty, or Fairmont Copley Square.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: Badger541
Reviews.Content: we stayed here 3 nights on a high floor at the back,whilst the view was not much it was quiet. Staff were helpfull especially the concierge who found us a van ride to the airport and took care of our luggage. The hotel is in the theatre district and near enough to all main locations so you can walk. having read the reviews of this hotel before iwe went we wonder if we were at the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Run away...fast!”
Reviews.Author: teri74
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel if you value your sleep and your wallet. We stayed in a corner suite on the sixth floor due to there being 5 of us. Every night at 2:00 am the bars would let out and the customers would have a party in the public parking right below the room. It would go on until at least 4:00 am. When we called the front desk, they knew about it (something they neglected to tell us at check in). The only thing they could do is call the police (who were also in the parking lot). After that it quieted down, but now I was wide awake at 4:00 am. The next night the same thing happened. When I asked about being moved to the other side of the building, I was told there were only suites on the corner we were on. Not once did they offer two connecting rooms. Because of the very poor sleeping conditions, I had a relapse of lupus. Also why have a suite with a refrigerator, but no microwave? When I asked for one, they said they normally charge $10.00 p/day, but they would wave the fee. Also, they wanted to charge $5.00 for us to park and load our car. When we wanted to eat the restaurant buffet for breakfast, it was going to be $20.00 p/person even for our 4 and 6 year old. The pool was awful! It was part of the YMCA and they made you wear swim caps. They would not allow the kids to play. Never again will I stay in this hotel. It is not worthy of the Hilton brand.

Reviews.Title: “What feng shui? Beware of advertising”
Reviews.Author: lscsdavis
Reviews.Content: The hotel website for this hotel says "Boston's newest Theater District hotel" and feng shui designed hotel. It also says the hotel has a pool and fitness center. None of these are entirely true. The hotel is over 9 years old and showing its age, our shower was in need of repair. And if feng shui means putting out a few asian themed decorations, ok, but in reality the placement of everything from the entrance to check in to the hallways was awkward. You need to take 2 different elevators to get from your car to your room. And finally, the pool and the fitness center are actually in the YMCA next door and are reached by crossing outside an exterior blacktop roof area. The Y is used by the local community and the hours are not convenient. On the plus side, this is a good location next door to a T stop. You can walk to most of the tourist areas in Boston in 15 minutes. The cookies are good and the staff was pleasant. But do you benefit from feng shui - no. As a Hilton silver VIP I expected better.

Reviews.Title: “Accomodating but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Officionada
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Washington St. Doubletree Hotel for 2 days on the 5th floor with a king bed. The receptionist was very welcoming and when we checked in she gave us 2 warm chocolate chip cookies, which made me very happy. Haha. I was surprised by the room b/c it was quite spacious. It had plenty of room to store 2 suitcases and not trip over them. The hotel is nice but not perfect, it does not have a new hotel look nor do the rooms, but I have to say the bed was very comfortable. And most important of all, the sheets were squeaky clean, pure white and neatly ironed. Just the way I like it. Plus, the room was quiet and I could sleep very soundly. The rooms have good â€œoldâ€� TVs, and not the new LCD screens. Right next to the hotel there is a T stop and it was quite convenient. Chinatown is close by as well. Boston Common is a few blocks away. Further up on Washington there are stores, restaurants, and some historic landmarks such as The Old State House/Boston Massacre site and Old Meeting House which is part of the Freedom Trail. The only thing that upset me at the hotel was on the 2nd floor, where you have your breakfast. The line was long for no apparent reason. There were about 5 empty spots at the bar and the people just kept on piling up confusingly. So I had to walk through the crowd to ask the waitress what was going on and if we could sit at the bar. She said that was fine. So what was the problem here? I was not sure. I went to get breakfast; there were no plates or forks. Later, I sat down at the bar with my breakfast and I asked for a fork, nothing. I walked up to the register where I could see clean forks and spoons and I asked the waitress to please hand me a fork, she picked it up and walked right by me. Hmm. I was confused myself by this point. So I just reached in and took the fork myself and sat myself down to have breakfast before heading out. The breakfast staff certainly needs some organizing b/c it was so scatter brained. Regardless of the breakfast incident, I would stay here again since the price was appropriate for a good location and I could relax in peace. Pics included.

Reviews.Title: “$13 for WiFi”
Reviews.Author: NYC-BCN
Reviews.Content: Unreasonable to charge for WiFi in 2010. Free in the lobby and $13 in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Sufficient if you cannot find anything else”
Reviews.Author: ladyfitch
Reviews.Content: Boston was busy this week and hotels were booked out everywhere seemingly. The double tree was not a hotel of preference, but it was available and close to where I was staying so I booked in there for one night. The lobby is quite nice and the staff friendly. Check in was a breeze and the cookie they give you was delicious actually. At times the lifts were a little slow, but there is a hexagonal staircase that you can take as there is not many floors in the hotel. The furnishings are 90s and dated, but there are signs stating that they are currently updating. My first impressions of the room were that it was spacious enough and neatly presented. The bed was very comfortable and large in size. There was a full size duvet that you could pull up which is rare these days and welcomed in winter for example. The AC unit was old and a little difficult to figure out, I think an lcd touch system would be much better. The room itself was nice enough but the bathroom was a let down. Small, with no bathrobe and only 2 thin towels. There were neutrogena shampoo, conditioner and body lotion and a bar of soap and shower cap. There is no bath and it is an old, ugly shower. The roof in the bathroom is like an office roof. There were hotels in the corners of some squares, quite unattractive and I question if disease can breed etc.. this way.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel - Decent Prices”
Reviews.Author: lem1783
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends for a night out in Boston. The hotel was fine - clean, comfy beds. Hotel was very, very busy during check-in. Also, there was no available water due to a water main issue, and the hotel did not have any ice or water. That was awful. I would guess it is not managed that well. Small rooms, but I recommend it for the price, which was reasonable for a city hotel on Saturday night. If you are spending time in your room, I would not stay here, but if you are in town to go out & be a tourist, it is perfect. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, convenient”
Reviews.Author: kaelap
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights @ Doubletree in June 2010 and had a great stay. We were fortunate to get a handicapped accessible room (I'm gonna ask for it next time!) b/c the bathroom was HUGE! And room was large, too. That's my new travel tip. Get the accessible room if available. Parking fees aren't cheap. But where is cheap to park your bean in Beantown?! T stop on orange line is right downstairs and up the block. The hotel was quiet and bed was comfy, and our shower had decent water pressure. We didn't take advantage of a lot of amenities so I don't have a lot to review - but like I said it was a great place to be esp if you want to eat in Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: JHP1
Reviews.Content: Pillow and bed sheet with bad smell Water leak from bath tub Excessive noise in the middle of the night (somebodies party outside hotel) Staff in general not very helpful and not friendly Check-in counter one floor up and it takes long time to wait for the life

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: urban_kowboy
Reviews.Content: Although pricey, this hotel gives you a lot for a major city downtown. It's a fair walking distance to Boston attractions like Boston Common, Public Garden, Cheers, and the Freedom Trail. And if you do have to venture out further, it's nice to know that a T Stop (orange line) is only footsteps away. Chinatown is also like a block and half down the street so trust me, you will be covered when it comes to food unless you want to try the hotel restaurant. Speaking of which, I wasn't crazy about their offerings. Nothing special and if you want the breakfast buffet, be prepared to shell out $25. I didn't have any so I couldn't tell you if it was worth it. Allow me to interject what another reviewer mentioned as "city noise" with this hotel. How on earth can you book a room in a hotel's downtown location in a major city like Boston and not expect the same noise you get from any other busy, thriving, metropolis in the heart of downtown? The fitness center they refer to actually belongs to the YMCA next door but it's free to hotel guests. You even have a special elevator that will take you between facilities so you don't even have to deal with YMCA front desk. The access is via rooftop where you will find a running/walking track to use if you want. The fitness center itself has a basketball court and free weights but keep in mind, they are not managed by the hotel. So if for some reason, the YMCA has something going on and you don't have access to something, then you will just have to deal with that. The business centers were alright. One on the main level and another on the 6th level with 2 workstations each. Parking is valet only and it's a rip-off $38. But one has to wonder why you would need one when this location is easy walking access to Boston's main attractions with T-stop next door. Even if you were to cab it, going to Fenway Park or Boston Harbor and back will cost you less than it would to park here for one night. All in all, if you want a comfortable and convenient hotel stay in Boston, this is the spot. You do get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Big City Noise”
Reviews.Author: epetet
Reviews.Content: Although the location of this hotel is good, within walking distance of much of downtown's businesses as well as historical sights, you also get many of the noises and hassles that come with the location. Parking is Valet only, for an extra charge of $38 per night and the hotel has an odd interior layout that seemed weakly lit and rather dated in appearance. My walk to my room took me down a hallway smelling of cigarette smoke and plenty of noise from TV's and conversations that could be heard from behind closed doors. Once settled in my room, I was able to relax until the fire alarm went off at 11:40 PM, I went outside to find the only other people out there were smokers who were watching the two fire trucks that had arrived. After 30 minutes or so, the fire trucks left and I and the smokers re-entered the building to see a crowded bar and lobby. Apparently, none of the hotel staff felt they should come out and give us an update on the situation. I returned to my room with the alarm still sounding and crawled back into bed as it stopped. I will look at different options in downtown Boston for my next stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, warning about the pool”
Reviews.Author: DJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights, two adults and two children. We reserved a suite (two separate rooms), but were given a Jr Suite due to being overbooked. They comped us free buffet breakfast in exchange and moved us to the suite the next day. The rooms are spacious and comfortable with standard amenities. Most rooms face the NEMC parking garage which is used by clubbers on the weekend and is very noisy at 2am. The location is excellent, 50 feet from the T, a block or two from Chinatown, 3 blocks from Boston Common, 10 minutes to Newbury St. etc The concierge was excellent and very helpful and the staff was great. The biggest problem with the hotel is that they DO NOT have a pool as advertise. They allow guests to have access to the pool at the YMCA which has very restrictive policies. Open swim for one hour a day, otherwise it's all lap swimming or lessons. You must all wear swimcaps. Kids not allowed without parents. It was a major letdown considering that we had two kids who were waiting for the pool and they couldn't swim as freely as they normally do at a hotel pool. Point is, this is false advertising and people should be warned. Otherwise, we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location...very average accomodations....”
Reviews.Author: smshw
Reviews.Content: Great location...close to the T, theater district...however....room was average....and two disturbances on two different nights was problematic.....first, a phone call from the desk that we were 'noisy'.....at 3:30am!! Woke us from sound sleep...and issue was two rooms away!! Staff need to come up to floor FIRST to check location...THEN make phone calls....Second night: emergency alarm at 3:00am.....false alarm, per staff.....thank goodness...but emergency instructions were confusing (espec at 3am!!).... Bar was good....food was below average.....I would recommend staying here for a 'deal'..but don't expect any 'extras'

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree Downtown Boston is nice!”
Reviews.Author: NeilfromDayton
Reviews.Content: Don't believe the reviews which say there is anything wrong with the Doubletree It is a nice place in a good location, close to the subway, 3 blocks from Boston Common, an easy walk to theaters & Freedom Trail. Decor is slightly out of date, but this is a fine, clean place to stay at half the cost of the average Boston hotel. A nice pleasant check-in at the front desk where we got cookies, maps, directions to Boston sights and good advice about subways and tourist buses. Our room was spacious, clean, the king bed was real good, bathroom was just fine. Internet computers with printers are available in 2 business centers. It was clean and quiet. Only thing I could complain about would be that the breakfast cost more than I wanted to spend. But there was a good coffee maker in the room and Starbucks in the lobby, Dunkin Donuts and McDonalds within 3 blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Close to T and downtown, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: aprilinlondon1970
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at the end of Feb 2010 to visit colleges in Boston with my daughter. Used Hilton points. The hotel was convenient to subway transportation (100 ft or so) and within walking distance of downtown, Newbury St, South End. Continental breakfast was tasty and plentiful. We had no need to upgrade to the full breakfast. Cookies were yummy, as always. Wait staff and bartenders, especially Jill, were very helpful and friendly. Room was very clean and showers had good flow. Enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, basic, affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: dcpatti
Reviews.Content: There's such a wide range of Doubletrees out there... this Doubletree is a little older and used to be something else--- apartment building maybe, or dorms--- so it's a little dated, and doesn't "feel" like a big downtown hotel. Which isn't a bad thing, just a little un-hotel-like if you can get that. For example the wall coverings in the hallway are faux tiles and it looks like your high school auditorium got repurposed. The rooms are nice, maybe a little small but between us we had three rooms: one nice-sized, a smaller one with a stunning view of the city skyline, and a junior suite. The suite isn't anything special so don't waste the extra dollars to upgrade--- it's really just a regular room with a little more space and a lot of wasted space on the entryway. The bathroom in the suite was pretty much the same as in the others, so we were a little disappointed by that. But the rooms were very clean and quiet, with a minimum of hallway and street noise permeating, but nowhere near what we expected, and that's more important anyway. The beds were quite comfy, plenty of pillows and nice crisp linens, and everything smelled fresh and clean. The breakfast buffet is underwhelming, not a lot of choices and what was there seemed like it sat just a few minutes too long. Not horrible, just not what I expected from a Doubletree. One of the bartenders was pretty snarky, like she was trying to make jokes and just didn't have the right sense of humor. I wasn't quite sure what to make of her! At the bar, stick to basic, simple drinks because the margarita mix is pretty bad and the bloody mary mix even worse. The location is fantastic, a block from a T station and about 3 blocks from Chinatown. Easy to get around without a car. Not entirely sure we'd stay there again, simply because there's so many other Hilton brand hotels in Boston and I'm a hotel snob, but if I ended up there again I wouldn't be miserable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: lo_travels
Reviews.Content: This Doubletree is about 2 minutes from the Orange Line T stop (New England Medical Center) and I can't say enough about how convenient that was- we try not to take our car into Boston and so being centrally located is important to us. I've stayed here before and in between this visit and my last the hotel has gone through a lovely renovation. This property is great if you are like me, and generally don't want to be fussed over by valet staff and concierges. The front desk staff and others are available and friendly if you do have a question, though. The gentleman running the bar on Friday and Saturday nights (2/26 and 2/27) was great and really friendly- my boyfriend proposed to me while in Boston and the bartender was really excited for us. I needed a band-aid at one point and one of the housekeeping ladies on the 2nd floor went down to get one for me rather than to have me go get it myself- it was a very nice extension of service and showed me that the staff would go the extra mile. We will definitely be back (again) to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Free cookie on arrival and the nice touches keep on coming!”
Reviews.Author: Abs140
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, posh enough to feel luxurious, but not pretentious enough to be annoying (no overbearing bell hops for instance). The room was spacious and spotless, the beds sooo comfortable with luxurious bedding. Neutrogenia toiletries are a nice touch too. Breakfast and room service VERY expensive, but there is a starbucks in the lobby. One bad point, they advertise highspeed wifi access in all rooms, but they don't tell you it is $12.95!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flower53_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Doubletree for 5 nights. For sure received at the reception the traditionnal doubletree cookies. The rooms are of a reseanable size, with comfortable bed, there is internet in the room, but it's not free. The bathroom is OK. The breakfast is a bit expensive, however there is a Starbucks downstairs, which can resolve the breakfast problem. The Hotel cafe is not bad, the food is OK for the Hotel food. Location is good, as almost everything is in the walking distance. There is a metro station in3 minutes from the hotel. Actually the hotel has a perfect pick-uop service, I was really surprised by the qaulity of car ( it was really very luxuary) and the price ( the same rate as for taxi).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jessi9260
Reviews.Content: Nothing to complain about and gotta love the cookies. The location is close to everything and the room was clean. The concierge negotiated a better shuttle price for me. Staff is very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service you can get!”
Reviews.Author: SamRotterdam
Reviews.Content: I guess the coffee machine hadn't been cleaned for more than three days. I called the front desk and they promised to send someone to get a new one for us. However, no one came at all!!!!!!! There was even no "sorry" when I told the staff my experience upon check-out. What a horrible service!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Staff, A Bit Dated”
Reviews.Author: afineguy
Reviews.Content: Great location. The hotel isn't anything fancy. A comfortable bed and working TV. Internet access a bit touchy. Not a bad place for the rate. Just fine for buisness.

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: jenghis77
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for 4 nights and have no complaints to make. The room was decent size (twin room) and the bathroom was clean. Had very little interaction with the staff as just using this as a base so can't really comment on them. The hotel is right next to a subway stop so very easy to get about. There is a starbucks downstairs in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure if 'dump' or 'pit' is the best word to describe it...”
Reviews.Author: COM4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ugly, old, and tired. The lobby is located up a semicircular staircase clad in a very 1980s ugly carpet pattern that can barely be made out through the dirt. The lobby is dominated by a fish tank filled with inappropriately large fish. The front desk staff are emotionless and inattentive. And ah, the rooms. So, this hotel consists of a building from, I'm guessing, the late 1970s or early 1980s, that has been haphazardly slapped onto some much older building. There are huge seems where you cross from one building to the next. The rooms in both buildings are small, cramped, and dark. The newer ones smell less - I suspect the new building served as the non-smoking section back in the day. Once inside my room, I found a collection of unmatched furniture (different woods, some different stone-topped items, mismatched lamps - all scratched and more or less dirty). This hotel still has those ridiculous old armoires with ancient tube TVs inside. The wallpaper is scuffed and peeling off the walls in multiple areas. Some rooms have nice Aeron chairs; mine had a medieval torture seat. This hotel DOES NOT have a fitness center. For some odd reason there is a YMCA tucked into / under this hotel and there is a way for hotel guests to get in there - by exiting onto a roof covered with air conditioning equipment, walking across totally uncovered, and taking an elevator down to the YMCA. Genius architecture! The YMCA is not open 24/7 by a long shot. It also mainly exists to serve the local Chinatown residents, not business travelers who want a quick workout. My room looked across Washington Street into some hospital rooms at Tufts Hospital. While I didn't mind this, there was lots of noisy ambulance and police car traffic. Also, there appear to be some ladies of the night milling about on the block. The cheap kind.

Reviews.Title: “Fair”
Reviews.Author: Maypag
Reviews.Content: Great location but it ends there. Staff was unfamiliar with local attractions and offers. Our room was clean however our toilet broke upon arrival and although fixed in a timely manner never really worked right. The shower was a very small stall shower with no place for a shampoo bottle or even a large bar of soap. We had only a desk chair in the room, nowhere else to sit but on the edge of the bed. Room service food was fair. We did not eat in the hotel because staff seemed unaware of actual hours meals were served. Since this location is good, we had a lot of choices for meals. Rock Bottom Brewery and Jacob Wirth were both a short walk and great food. Legal Seafood ( an institution in Boston) was OK. Free internet avail in the lobby only. Advice: Shop around before booking here. We probably could have done better.

Reviews.Title: “Two Thumbs Up!”
Reviews.Author: teach2525
Reviews.Content: Staff welcomes you with warm chocolate chip cookies. Always a great beginning! Staff were generally very accommodating with any questions or concerns. Less than a block from the 'T'. Appreciated use of the business center to do computer work and printing. Some problems with all the computers working, however. Do not expect a shuttle from the airport. General reservations is wrong about that. Overall, a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Obsolete hotel”
Reviews.Author: jackshark
Reviews.Content: With plenty of superior options nearby (Radisson, Marriott, etc) for similar prices, there is really no reason why this hotel even exists. As people have said, the parking situation is poor and expensive. The internet is expensive and slow, and only worked in one corner of our room. The computers in the "business centers" ran at a snail's pace, and would abruptly close down while we were in the middle of using them. The rooms themselves were good - not spectacular, but comfortable. The surrounding area has its share of unsavory characters, which is no big deal, until you realize that several of these street people are guests or visitors at the hotel. With all the other options in the immediate area, and metro Boston in general, unless you score a great deal, there is NO reason I would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: RadioJoe
Reviews.Content: I don't remember a lot about the room itself unfortunately because I stayed there one night just before a 7-day New England/Canada cruise but, the concierge/bell-hop was very helpful and attentive. I forget his name but he was African or middle-eastern with glasses. I didn't like that you had to take stairs or one slow and relatively small elevator to the reception area. Inconvenient if you have medium/large luggage with you. A hotel at this level of quality should offer free/cheap wifi rather than just 4 computer workstations. Good location, near good restaurants and some shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't have changed a thing”
Reviews.Author: mfroze
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed in the Boston Doubletree in the theatre district and were very pleasantly surprised. Before arriving, we had read some 'so-so' reviews of the area, and were considering staying elsewhere, but in the end, we were very happy with our choice. It is literally right outside of the T-stop, which couldn't have been more convenient, and was very easy to walk many places. The staff was friendly, and it was attached to the local Y, which was much better than the standard hotel-gym. Would highly recommend for cost conscious travellers in Boston who don't mind taking the T (metro).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, centrally-located hotel”
Reviews.Author: openingbat52
Reviews.Content: Great location right next to T station, very close to Boston Common and about 10 mins walk to downtown. Rooms were very comfortable indeed - modern, clean and very spacious. Absolutely everything we wanted. Front dest staff were OK, but we asked them to mail a postcard for us (pre-stamped) and it never arrived. .Good restaurants nearby (had a lovely meal at McCormick & Schmick's Seafood restaurant). The breakfast buffet in the restaurant was a little pricey so we opted for the Starbucks inside the lobby (nice smoothies). New England Medical Center is just across the road but we only heard a medical helicopter once. Otherwise it was very quiet, with just the patter of rain outside. Would definitely stay again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Sleazy, sleazy, sleazy”
Reviews.Author: jameswigs
Reviews.Content: Even though the hotel is old and poorly equipped, I can't imagine it being in such a severe need of money that the management rents rooms to women who are obviously prostitutes. I stayed for 5 days, so I was at the hotel during the week as well as the weekend, and I couldn't tell you the number of times I saw scantily-dressed women entering and exiting the hotel with a different man every 15 minutes. It's disgusting. What's worse is that the hotel proudly displays a plaque from "The Community of Chinatown" commending the hotel for their "community service." What service is that? Bringing the after-hours street life of downtown Boston indoors with businesspeople, elderly people, and families? Service was good. Hotel overall is lacking. Stay if you get a good rate, otherwise stay away.

Reviews.Title: “You Can't Beat Doubletree for Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: ahenkel3400
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at a Doubletree in the past two months. The service my husband and I received at both properties was exceptional. Yes, the property looks a bit run-down compared to its more glamorous competitors a few blocks away; however, I saw notices posted in the elevator that refurbishment was to begin soon. The Doubletree staff, however, cannot be beat--everyone we came into contact with took initiative, was professional and efficient, and extremely accommodating. Based on both of my Doubletree experiences, and speaking as someone who worked in the hospitality industry for almost five years, I was most impressed. Doubletree will always be first choice from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dnayer
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate from Priceline. For the price we paid ($70 including taxes and fees), this hotel was superb. Right next to a T station, Chinatown and very close to Boston Common. Parking is a expensive at $36 per night. If you are staying over a weekend, search around for parking. The cheapest I found was the Boston Common Grarage which charged $11 per day on weekends and holidays and it only about a 10 minute walk from the Hotel. The other option is to leave your car near a T stop and take the T is as the hotel is literally next to the New England Medical Center stop (Orange line). I don't know if I would pay full price to stay at this hotel, but for the price I paid, it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: chriskum
Reviews.Content: I booked here because I am a Hilton Honors member and I needed to be near the subway so my daughter could get here. Parked my car for $35/night. Everyone charges for that, so it was no big deal to me--be aware. The hotel had everything important to me--good beds, clean, quiet, and efficient staff. Just don't be afraid to ask questions--some of the staff seemed to assume I knew my way around. Free wi-fi available in lobby and adjoining starbucks. Once I had the code, it worked it my room as well. Overall, this was a wonderful stay. Due to my booking error online, I was scheduled to check out one day earlier than I wanted but a nice young man (Chris) found a way to keep my room even though a girl at the desk told me they were overbooked and I would have to go. Across the street from Tufts Medical so it is busy, but that was fine. Close to Chinatown, Theater District. Great neighborhood. Maybe not for families with little kids, except they are attached to a YMCA with a pool, I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy place to stay thats it”
Reviews.Author: thecaddens
Reviews.Content: Alot to be said about checking in. We arrived after 8 hours travelling to no greeting, cookies or manners. We were asked for our credit card straight away, then handed a card and that was it, your on your own. Where was the american big greeting. Reception staff at times we felt couldn't be bothered answering questions or helping you. Quite expensive for the food, breakfast buffet was $20 ea when there are 3 of you is quite alot. Our room was huge and clean, housekeeping work hard. Bar staff need more personality and manners But out and about in boston is great. Do the duck tours and silver grey trolley tours they are brillant. Also a trip to Salem is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Know What You're Getting...”
Reviews.Author: starstruck101
Reviews.Content: We came for a one night stay to attend the theatre. Based on web searches, we specifically chose a hotel with a swimming pool because we enjoy swimming when we can. A pool is listed as an amenity of the hotel on the website, but we found when we arrived that the pool is actually at the next door YMCA. We felt mislead. We walked to the YMCA to observe a day care worker disciplining a group of little campers right next door to the pool, and so decided to skip the pool experience. What a disappointment! Also to note, when we checked in, the man at the desk was not well-suited to the hospitality business. He barely looked up from his computer/desk as though he was afraid to make eye contact. He perfunctorily checked us in, plopped two paper wrapped cookies on the counter as our welcome, and said nothing. No "have a good stay", "let me know if you need anything" no nothing! We were not comfortable asking him questions, although later we had to ask for more linens, as the room had been supplied for only one person, and he immediately sent more. In the room itself, the carpet was stained and rather nasty looking, but the bed was comfortable. The bartender was accommodating and friendly. The parking lot attendants and bellmen were helpful and polite. We did express our concerns to the manager, who was very kind and refunded the cost of our two bar drinks. He assured me that the website would be changed to say that guests have ACCESS to a pool - not that the hotel HAS a pool. We'll see if that actually happens.. Given that the hotel does overlook a hospital emergency room and a parking lot , and needs a few upgrades, its prices (including a hefty fee to park) are on the high side. I'd pay a little more, though, to be in a nicer place on my next visit to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Feng Shui on 2nd floor - stay away from room 262”
Reviews.Author: sdb730
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was accomodating to an early check in and gave us a room on the 2nd floor. The room overlooked the parking lot and the echo from the street into the interior parking courtyard was immediately evident. You could also see the emergency room from across the street and it didn't take much to imagine how loud it would be if the ambulances had an emergency. We asked to change rooms. The front desk was cooperative and switched us to Room 262. We were told this room was much quieter because it was closer to the YMCA. The noise was slightly quieter, but not much. I wanted to change rooms again, but my husband thought we should give it a try. Huge mistake. We're not light sleepers and despite being extremely tired, the street noise woke us up with less than 4 hours of sleep. To make matters worse, it wasn't until the next morning that I realized that the shower stall in this room was filthy. (Only one bar of soap in this bathroom by the way.) There was mold and mildew in the corners. The water pressure in the shower was non existent and the plastic shower head was so clogged that the water came out in a dribble. I'm near sighted so I didn't realize the shower was so gross until I put my glasses on to see what was up with the shower head with so little water coming out. I was appalled and took a photo on my camera to show the front desk. We asked to change rooms. The front desk staff was extremely apologetic and they told us to pack our luggage and have it ready in our room. They would move us to a new room later in the day when more rooms came available. They'd have the key ready for us with the new room number at the end of the day when we came back from sightseeing. When we returned to the room later that evening, our room had not been changed and we were told the hotel was sold out and that there was nothing that could be done. We spoke to a manager who apologized for the breakdown in communication of his staff, but said there was nothing there were no other rooms available. He said he could comp us for some items on our bill, as if that would make things all better. I showed the night manager the digital photo of the shower and told him that the room should never have been assigned. We had a wedding to go to the next day and I told him I refused to use the shower in its present condition. He said he didn't have a room to change us to until the next day and that the best he could do was send someone from maintenance to work on the shower. I agreed to the shower being worked on at that late hour (after 11pm) and said that I still wanted to change rooms. He said to keep our bags packed and the room would be changed the next day while we were out. The following day we were finally moved to another room on the 5th floor. It was as if we were in another hotel. The bathroom was clean, we had a shower/tub combo, the shower head was metal and we had excellent water pressure. We actually got two bars of soap for the bath room and we even had two more Neutrageana toiletries that were not in our previous room. The room was still on the street side, but with it being higher up the street traffic was more like background noise instead of like you were sleeping on the street. This room was definitely more acceptable and we're sorry we didn't have this room sooner. If we hadn't pre-paid for the hotel stay in advance we would have found some place else to stay. The pre-raid rate was only $20 less that the rack rate so we didn't get a particularly good deal on the hotel. If we had the room on the 5th floor for the whole stay it would have been worth it, but we didn't. Other comments: Evening bartender was extremely rude. Had an excellent server all three days for breakfast. When calling for Room Service, the call went into voice mail multiple times and they didn't retrieve messages. It wasn't until them finally answering the phone that the order was taken. Food was ok. 5th floor much cleaner and nicer than the 2nd floor. Carpet everywhere needed to be cleaned. No chocolate chip cookies If it weren't for the 5th floor room, the overall review for this hotel would have been Terrible. Cleanliness/Value/Rooms got an additional circle due to the room on the 5th floor. Service got an additional service because of the morning breakfast server.

Reviews.Title: “Blah”
Reviews.Author: tmarcone
Reviews.Content: Cashed in some reward points prior to an early flight out of Logan. Rooms were clean and comfortable - flat screen TV was a nice touch. The location is squeezed in between Tufts Medical facilities but easy access to the Orange line if needed and walknig distance to about everything in Boston. Staff was burnt out - not a smile or extension of service to be found. If you are looking for a blah, no thrills experience this is the spot. As noted not a bad value for cashing in points or a priceline deal.

Reviews.Title: “never take a room that overlooks the parking lot!”
Reviews.Author: sfmghr
Reviews.Content: parking at this hotel is valet parking in a very overcrowded lot adjacent to the hotel. from 6:30am, the valets start to jockey cars for their guests and the alarms, sometime 2 and 3 at a time go off constantly until about 9:00am. so if you wish to sleep in, never take a room tthet overlooks the parking lot. the rest of the amenities are typical in price and service for Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Strange Hotel - not great location”
Reviews.Author: johngie
Reviews.Content: The hotel had signs in the elevators advertising the upgrading of rooms but it was hard to tell if this had happened yet. The room I stayed in was functional but drab as was the hotel itself. It is beside a YMCA that it uses for its health club - the street outside is non-descript and the overall location is not very convenient if you are staying here as a tourist. Overall it is an uninspiring place, a little on the ugly side and best for a one-night passing through stay otherwise I would skip it. I was on business and there for only the one night and it was ok for that - just!

Reviews.Title: “Not a good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: gpotts5626
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because of its location. I assumed that it would be a good business hotel, but I was wrong. I arrived in my room and the toilet was broken. The maintenance staff was very quick to come up and repair it, though. There are no power outlets on the desk. I had to move it to reach the outlets behind it. The wireless internet only worked if I was less than 5 ft from the door. Otherwise the signal strength was poor or non-existent. The business center had really old computers that were o slow that they timed-out while I was trying to load and print my boarding pass. Food and service at the bar was very good. The continental breakfast was not. I sat in the breakfast area for 45 minutes and they never refilled the empty fruit or pastry containers which eft a breakfast selection of toast or cereal. I asked twice to no avail.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: WDestinations
Reviews.Content: I liked the place basically because it was convenient. Just 1 min walk from the New England Train Station on the Orange line. About a 5 min walk from Chinatown with lots of reasonable eating options. Lots of other restaurants on Stuart street. We tried Montien (thai - food was ok but the waitress that served us was terrible. She never said a word and had a long face and was unhappy when we asked for sauces etc), Legal seafood was great, Cheesecake factory was a good old staple. Good Tip: A 7-11 nearby on Stuart and Washington Street (a good tip on where to get drinks and snacks and avoid the hotel minibar). There is also a starbucks on the location but closes early. I took a 20 min walk to copley place so all in all, i thought the location was convenient. The front desk staff was ok. There were professional and attended to our request but I didn't get super warm or friendly feeling, The good thing is there is a security guard in addition to the front desk at night. The double beds were on the smaller side. It can fit 2 people but there's no room to turn so hopefully neither of you will toss and turn too much. The room is of a reasonable size. I read some reviews here that said the rooms were small and was concerned about that but mine was of a good size with enough space to put luggage and move around comfortably. The bathroom was of a reasonable size too. 4 things I was annoyed with. 1. The dark red cover on the bed seemed dusty and I tried to avoid using and touching it. 2. The fridge in the room was more like a mini vending machine with all the mini bar items and you can't use it to put a can of your own coke or anything in it 3. the internet connection in the hotel during my 1.5 week stay there was spotty. For 2 day , the WiFi was down. Then other days the computer in the room was not working. It was somewhat annoying to have to deal with and to have to go to the lobby everytime i wanted to use the internet. *they charge u $10 for using the internet in room* 4. Do NOT use the phone even for 1800 numbers. I thought it was ridiculous that they charged me for calling a 1800 nunmber since it's free!! I paid $170 + tax for the room. I read about other ppl getting the room cheap and I tried but didn't manage to. You get free access to the fitness center and pool at the YMCA right next to the hotel. We didn't have time to use it though. The car park was $36/overnight which seemed really expensive to me - thank goodness i didn't have a car!!

Reviews.Title: “Just fine. Quirky downtown location probably not for tourists.”
Reviews.Author: 1KeeneTraveler
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal with Priceline ($50). I lived in Boston for 8 years, so there were no surprises. The hotel is surrounded by the Tufts New England Medical Center and is located between Chinatown, the Theater District and the South End. It's a so-so location for tourists, at best. Several blocks to the T (subway) and no shops or restaurants nearby to speak of. Go here for business or if you get a great deal, assuming the location is acceptable. If you have business the Tufts NEMC, the location can't be better.

Reviews.Title: “great deal for a quick trip”
Reviews.Author: msusparty
Reviews.Content: i had an interview, and i got an amazing deal staying here, something in the ballpark of $100 a night, i got it because i paid upfront ahead of time (no refund if you cancel) with my credit card. Keep this place in mind if you ever need a quick place, it's right off the T, I mean RIGHT off the T, so basically your plane lands, you jump on a free shuttle to the subway and get on 1 train, ride a few stops and you're there. You really can't beat the price or location, the rooms are spacious, my bed had something like 9 pillows on it, and there is a pretty long hallway from your entryway/bathroom to the bedroom area (it really is a pretty large room). The beds and pillows are very comfortable and the bathroom was very nice, the iron and ironing board were in good working condition as well. I also went downstairs and got the free internet code for the lobby...turns out it can reach into your room as well if you're not up too high! Not my fault it still connected for free... The hotel is connected to the local YMCA, so that is the gym facilities should you so choose to use them. I recommend trying legal seafoods if you're into that type of cuisine. Right across the street from Tufts dental and medical (right in china town), just a short ride to harvard/cambridge area.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, reasonably central location and clean”
Reviews.Author: rwchicago
Reviews.Content: My experience with this hotel was very positive. I found a great last minute deal on Travelocity, and was more than satisfied with the value I received. While it isn't as centrally located as Copley Square, it is less than a block from a "T" subway station (orange line, New England Medical Center/Tufts), and if you like sightseeing on foot, it is within walking distance to Boston Common. (Chinatown is also just a few blocks away, where there are Vietnamese, Thai and other Asian restaurants in addition to Chinese.) This hotel seemed like a newer property, or else was very well maintained and had been redecorated. The furnishings in my room seemed new and the king size bed was very comfy. Everything was spotless. Although there was a lot of bustle in the lobby, my 2nd floor room was very quiet and I had a good night's sleep. The staff was friendly. There is a restaurant, bar and also a Starbucks in the lobby, but I didn't try them out. The rooms are also equipped with minibars. Evidently they have a tradition of offering guests a freshly baked chocolate chip cookie upon check in, which was a nice surprise. Overall, I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and staff were helpful above and beyond expectations”
Reviews.Author: frogstarCanberra
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Doubletree in Boston for two nights at the end of March. We chose it based on other reviews and also because of the price (great value at only US$90 a night) and the location - its walking distance to many attractions and right next door to a T station for more further afield spots. Beyond all these expectations which were met, I was also highly impressed with the service - we arrived at 8 am (a full 7 hours before normal check-in) and were told that we could get straight into our room for no extra charge. As we'd taken a red-eye from LA I was so thankful! The rooms are comfortable and clean - on the small size but perfectly adequate. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel, especially if you can get it for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy in front rooms of hotel facing hospital”
Reviews.Author: jjhardy715b
