Reviews.Content: I like the conveniecne of the hotel . It is located right across the street to Tufts Medical Center. I have early appointments at the hospital. All I have to do is walk across the street. The metro system also is located steps from the hotel which is another great plus. The only thing about the hotel is the rooms that face the hospital are noisy. You can hear the trucks rumbling down the road, the abulances with their sirens, and cars driving up and down the road at all hours of the night. Next time I go up I will request a room on the other side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: tbear8688
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderfully located hotel, right next door to the subway across from NE Medical Center and close to the theater district. Easy walking distance to Boston Common. It was a little confusing checking in, the lobby is up one floor from the street. Our room was on the 5th floor, we had a nice view of the street. Corner room. It is one of the smallest rooms I've ever had but we weren't there to stay in the room. It was clean, nice toiletries. I have read reviews stating they had problems with getting enough soap, but we had no problems. The concierge was not helpful at all. I was looking for a recommendation for a good comedy club. He misunderstood and offered me restaurants. When I reiterated what I was looking for he directed me to the front desk. My experiences with concierges is usually have a good knowledge of the area and attractions. Not this one. The front desk tried their best but were unable to direct me. They had a binder with information on shows and such. I'm familiar with Boston but was disappointed that I knew more about the area than the concierge. I was disappointed with the housekeeping. We left and did the guided freedom trail tour, went to lunch and walked around in the north end. We got back around 2:30pm and our room hadn't been cleaned. It states housekeeping can come anytime until 3pm. Around 2:45pm we saw them and vacated the room (even though we wanted to rest after all that walking.) We came back awhile later and noticed we had no cream to go with our morning coffee. About an hour after that our door suddenly opened and housekeeping walked in (surprised we were there) and gave us the cream. The bar was okay, they must have been changing shifts because we were told to settle up after having one drink because she was leaving. Nice bed- comfy. Hilton seems to be going for consistency in all their hotels, same products, same beds etc. and it's a nice touch. Not the best Double tree I've stayed in but not the worst hotel I've been to. One other thing, there is a mini bar with outrageously priced items. I was so thirsty, I wanted a drink from the vending machines. Guess what, the vending machines only sell candy & such. If you want a drink you'll have to pay a high price or find a store.

Reviews.Title: “A great time!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dancer30
Reviews.Content: Got to the hotel on a cold wet windy evening and was warmly greeted by Neil at the front desk. Made us feel very welcome with hot choc chip cookies. Was on third floor room No.354 with view of the medical centre. Room was bigger than expected after reading other reviews, bathroom was huge with nice amenities. Two bars of soap!!!! Room was lovely and warm, bed was soooo lovely, a king. Lovely Wolfgang puck coffee in the room. Didn't use the mini bar too expensive. Food and drinks in the bar was very good can recommend the brushetta pizza, and chicken wings. T stop right next door to hotel which was great for access all over the city. Used the T to get to and from the airport so easy it only took 20 mins. Had good food and drinks in the Rock Bottom Brewery around the corner in Stuart St. Must visit the Free Sam Adams Brewery tour only a few stops away on the T. Overall a brilliant stay, with easy walking distance of bars and resturants, shops etc.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is ok, but the staff are sooo stiff...”
Reviews.Author: JaaBirks
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the price and location, and of course because Hilton hotel should offer some security for the quality you receive. Warm cookie was a nice welcome gift, but the receptionist seemed somewhat ill and uninterested in us. As we later found out the staff seems to be trained in stiffness and not smiling at all. No matter if we were passing reception desk or having a breakfast we did not receive attention or "hello's" from the staff. Only smile I saw from the hotel staff was from a room maid. Breakfast also turned out to be confusing, because we were informed what is included in the breakfast package and what is not. Staff were acting like they were even more confused than we were and we had to ask them for things like spoons, forks, dishes etc.. There was a room service plate with dishes lying in the hallway near one guests room and it kept lying there for almost 2 days. It didn't bother me much, but it left a sound impression of the staff's attitude towards servicing their guests. You also have to pay additional 10$ a day for the wireless internet - that is a daylight robbery I must say. I was charged even more for the internet than I ordered and the receptionist didn't even apologize for that - how hard is it to say that "we apologize"? Everything else, that is thing regarding hotel amenities, rooms etc. was in good condition. Our room was spacy, bathroom was clean and large enough. TV was large and there was a coffee and tea maker in the room. Also the view was great from our room. So the bottom line is if you need a place to stay without communicating with the hotel staff this is a good place to stay, but if you want to feel welcome or use the internet you could consider some other places. Overall we were satisfied with the stay and made fun of the staff's incompetence and stiffness.

Reviews.Title: “Best ever!”
Reviews.Author: Ribieroise
Reviews.Content: this hotel is simply the best. Only thing it could use is better food.

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: grobma
Reviews.Content: I just needed a room to sleep in and being a Hilton Honors member I selected this one because it was the cheapest in the area that night. I was somewhat concerned after reading previous reviews, but had a fine stay. The location is very convenient if you have to be at NEMC and itâ€™s walking distance to Chinatown as well. Boston is a very â€œwalkableâ€� city. While there are certainly more desirable locations, this one isnâ€™t bad and is close to many things â€“ especially the theater district. The lobby and staff were fine â€“ nothing outstanding but nothing bad either. My room, contrary to other reports, was sized nicely and everything worked. Very high ceilings which was a pleasant surprise. The hallways wind around a lot and I can see how they would be confusing. The dÃ©cor of the hotel (and the room) reminded me more of a college dorm than a Hilton property. About the soap. I had read previous reports about there being only one bar in the room and experienced the same thing. I am sure that someone in the back office is getting praise for saving money with this approach, but it is pretty annoying and I wonder if the bad press counters the cost-savings. I have two bars of soap at home â€“ one at the sink for my hands and face, and one in the shower/tub for other body parts. Aside from perceived â€œhygieneâ€� issues, this also means that two people cannot be using the bathroom at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Checked out and switched our stay within an hour.”
Reviews.Author: fballm0m
Reviews.Content: Small rooms, crazy hallways, and toilet didn't work when we checked in. Maintenance came up quickly to fix the toilet which was greatly appreciated. Only pool is in the YMCA that you must travel across a rooftop to enter, and bring a towel with you as they won't have any. You'll also need a bathing cap or you can borrow one from them, if you can get into the 1/4 of the pool left open from lessons, etc. None of this was our idea of an overnight getaway pretend vacation. We switched to the Doubletree Guest Suites on Soldier's Field Road.....clean, open, pool/hottub IN the hotel, friendly, park your own car, less Hilton Honors rewards points and really not as far out of the city as you'd think!

Reviews.Title: “No Good”
Reviews.Author: Shay70
Reviews.Content: I was surprised that is was a DoubleTree. Fung Shui? Not really noticible because of the mismatched decor and well lived-in look. I paid for a suite and received a shoebox. A family member called it a broomcloset. Very confusing, embarrassing. Smallest hotel room I've stayed in. The employees were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Better than other reviews have suggested”
Reviews.Author: Bonbonmontreal
Reviews.Content: We (two parents and a small child) stayed at this hotel in conjunction with an unplanned trip to Boston. We obtained the room through Priceline (our winning bid was $51, and with various taxes and service charges, the total bill was nearly $70). The timing of the visit did not allow us to make use of any of the hotel amenities. The hotel is located in a relatively urban part of downtown Boston; not unsafe in any way, but not especially charming, either. Chinatown and public transportation are all within easy walking distance. There's a Starbucks right next to the hotel lobby; a McDonalds is about 200 yards down the street to the left. To drop off luggage, you must enter a small open parking lot, and it's not immediately clear where you should go. There is no doorman on site; he is stationed inside at a location where he can monitor foot traffic. When he showed up later, he asked me, "Can I help you, man?" (Have I traveled back to 1972?) Complaint: Parking for the hotel is "valet only" - a bit of false advertising, since the "valet" is a virtually incomprehensible guy sitting in a tiny booth who seemed extremely reluctant to leave and come out into the cold (who could blame him; it was 8 degrees F). The parking cost is $36, and the lot is not covered or protected. This is totally unacceptable. TIP: Go across the street and park in the underground, secure (and on this cold January night ... warm!) parking lot associated with the medical center. The cost (for a visit of less than 12 hours) was $14, rather than $36 for the open, unguarded "valet" parking. It's $28 for a full day. The lobby was clean and uncluttered, though there's a bar rather incongruously located just to the left of the check-in area. Our check-in clerk was extremely pleasant and efficient. The room was clean, and sufficiently spacious, with a king-size bed, a desk, small sofa, and in-house Wolfgang Puck coffee. The bed was above average in comfort. The alarm clock time was off by one hour, and there was no way to correct the time! The bathroom was large enough for two adults to be inside at the same time. Other commentary on this hotel has been mixed. From my perspective, at the price we paid and given its location, we were very happy with the deal we got. Use it as a base for traveling around town, because of the access to public transportation. Use it if you've got business at the medical center. But if you're looking for an "entertainment" hotel, there may be better choices.

Reviews.Title: “An Embarrassment to the Hilton Hotel Family”
Reviews.Author: RichardS_7
Reviews.Content: This hotel really does not care about it's guests. That's the feeling I got on each of my four days at the hotel. FIRST AND FOREMOST -- IT'S NOT in a great area. It's across from the medical center -- so if that's your destination, great! But if you are hoping to walk to anything except some awful Chinese take-out places, avoid this location. If you read all the reviews of this hotel, you will be left with the impression that management really does not care to make things good for its guests. That's EXACTLY the same impression I got. Here are some problems I experienced. . . 1. Internet access is terrible. EXTREMELY SLOW -- LOTS OF DISCONNECTS. Terrible! The hotel should be ashamed to charge $300.00 per month ($10.00 per day, plus tax) for this lousy service. 2. Front desk help is hit or miss. One agent that works nights (Julia I think) not only provided terrible directions, she was clearly bothered by the questions I asked. For example, when I asked if there was a close convenience store, she said "just make a left and you will see CVS." She failed to say it was a half-mile away. An important point when it's 11 degrees and windy outside with half a foot of snow. So after walking a few blocks we turned around and came back wondering where it was. . . .then the front door man told us it was quite a ways up the road. That we needed to keep walking several more blocks. 3. Maid service provided ONE bar of soap in the bathroom. We had to move it back and forth from shower to sink. Figuring the next day we would get more soap. NOPE! No new soap after housekeeping made up the room. So we had to call the front desk. 5 minutes later maintenance appeared at the door and had no idea what we needed except that he got a call to come to our room. It took a while, but finally we got another bar of soap. We never got another bar of soap during our 4-day stay. 4. Carpet was stained and poorly patched in many places. Additionally I needed to move the night table out from the wall to plug in my laptop and was disgusted with the garbage on the floor behind the night table left there by previous guests. 5. We had requested a room with a microwave oven. It wasn't there on check in. When I called for one, they sent up the oldest dented dirty microwave oven I have ever seen. It was an early 1980's model that took 6 minutes to reheat coffee and 10 minutes to make a cup of water hot enough for tea. Additionally, all the numbers and words were rubbed off so it took a while to figure out whether you are cooking on high or low. 6. The bar is an embarrassment. My wife and I were interested in a glass of red wine. The selection was not only awful (two reds available by the glass), they were terribly cheap wines. Yet, they were charging $9 and $11 per glass. These were the wines that cost $6.99 and $8.99 a bottle at any liquor store. Overall the condition of our room and the overall impression with this hotel was closer to a Motel-6 than a typical Doubletree. The hotel is in desperate need of a renovation. I would not stay here again . . .

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1NicePerson
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located and more than adequate for a Boston visitor. Hotel is within easy walking distance to downtown and the South End and is next door to the NE Medical Center T Station (Orange Line). Staff at the reception are very pleasant and the rooms are clean, modern and comfortable. Note that Tuft's hospital is just across the street so if you get a room facing Washington St. you may here ambulances from time to time. Buffet breakfast at the Wisteria restaurant was good and the male host and female omelet chef were very nice. The other so-called waitresses walked around like unmotivated zombies; perhaps they didn't get enough sleep the night before! All in all, however, if you're looking for a centrally located clean and safe place to stay, this Doubletree is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ecljohnson
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree Boston Downtown was a delight. It was clean, had good service and a nice location. Two comments, not complaints; the concierge said it was a ten minute walk from the hotel to the Blue Line (T). It was a good 20 minute walk and I am fit! The Orange Line is right next door, but you would have to make 2 changes to get to the Blue which goes directly to the airport (Logan). Also, the waitress/bartender on duty one evening was not all that cordial except to the customers she knew by name. They got more snacks and better service. At $10 for a glass of wine (including tip), I thought service could have been better as I had to get up and go get my drink while she brought the others to their table. When I checked in, the front desk gentleman was very efficient and polite. Extremely quick check in. The 20 minute walk is great when weather is good. You walk straight down Washington St. from the hotel to the historic district of the Old State House, Faneuil Hall, Boston Massacre, etc. Lots of shops and restaurants along the way.

Reviews.Title: “Forgetable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Docski
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed Boston, but I dislike having my car taken away and valet parked and being charged for it, I dislike being charged for wi-fi access, I dislike rooms with minibars that you can't use as a fridge, I dislike hotel chains that charge a lot, give you a cookie , then add charges for everything else, especially when it is with an indifferent shrug of the shoulder and a "so be it." I suppose I won't deliberately choose Double Tree again. That said the room was comfortable - as was the bed with good air con and a reasonable view - and I enjoyed Boston. Particularly the tram trip (we British did SO MANY bad things - it was great!) - and the whale viewing boat trip. I advise - do the whale trip! Oh and the hotel was in a good location - not far from a bar with a poster advising beer on medicinal grounds. Now thats my kind of bar! See picture.

Reviews.Title: “Great Cookies!!”
Reviews.Author: HappyIsles
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was very good. It was a very clean and tidy hotel with a comfortable bed, free internet, mini- bar, access to the YMCA gym and a decent size bathroom. The location was also good and was easy walking distance to Boston's main sites. The only downside was that the T.V had terrible reception, however, when you are travelling you don't really care about what's on T.V!! Overall, a great stay!! And a lovely chocolate chip cookie on arrival!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but hotel itself is lacking...”
Reviews.Author: MachThree
Reviews.Content: Overall, had a dissapointing experience at this hotel. I suppose I shouldn't expect too much from a Doubletree, but I've stayed in MUCH nicer doubletree's. First and foremost, the room seemed extremily loaded up with furniture and so was really cramped. Second, the lobby itself was just not very nice and was crammed in with a rather uninviting bar and had a multilevel arrangement which made it seem even more cramped. And third, although Doubletree advertises this hotel as having a gym, in reality there is a YMCA next door to the hotel, and using the gym there is free for hotel guests. This is really not a nice touch - the Y was extremily smelly and unless you want to work out with local street kids, its probably not for you. On the plus side, the location is good - its next to Chinatown, and its a short walk to the Boston Commons area and many other sights.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean”
Reviews.Author: aorton
Reviews.Content: This Doubletree has a great location. It is located just on the border of China Town. The T station (Orange Line) is located right next door. It is an easy walk to the Commons or to the Back Bay area. Just returned from our second stay here. When we stayed here two years ago I was amazed by how friendly and helpful the staff was. Then the staff knew your name and went out of their way to be friendly. Apparently those staff members are no longer with the hotel. The staff was not rude, but they were not nearly as friendly as the previous visit. The bedding and bed is wonderful. I the carpet in our room was a little worn, but they do have signs up indicating they are changing the carpet throughout the hotel. The room and bathroom seemed very clean. The bathroom only had a shower. It would had been nice to have a tub to soak your feet/legs in after a long day of sightseeing. Make sure you request a room that does not face Washington Street. Our room was on the 5th floor and faced Washington Street. The traffic noise made it difficult to sleep. While I worried that the hospital noise would keep me up, we hear no sirens at night. The issue was more bus and truck traffic. I wished we would had moved rooms after our first night. I slept very little during the 4 nights that we were there due to traffic noise. There are not alot of restaurants right next to the hotel. There is a McDonalds and Au Bon Pain on the same block as the hotel. Otherwise you will have to walk up to the Park Square area or Back Bay. We did walk a number of times to Beacon Hill area for great lunches and breakfast. Of our 4 night stay at the hotel, 2 nights were reward nights and we spent around $230 for the other two nights. The hotel did lower their rates about 2 days before our arrival. I suggest if you book directly with Hilton to check the rates again a few days before your trip. On our next trip to Boston I would consider staying here again because of the proximity to the "T" and the Commons area.

Reviews.Title: “Room was great but front desk staff were not.”
Reviews.Author: Riget
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Doubletree Boston - Downtown from 22 May to 24 May. I was travelling with friends and we reserved two rooms in total. The location of the hotel is quite central, it's just about one block away from Chinatown and about 3-4 blocks away from South Station, which is a major station for buses such as Greyhound, Coach USA and Peter Pan etc. The room that i stayed in was very beautiful with two double beds and i got 2 good nights of sleep there. Check in was great and we were each given a warm freshly baked chocolate chip cookie to welcome us to the hotel. That gave us a very good impression of the hotel. The rest of our two day stay was good and uneventful. However the trouble came on the last day before we were to check out. When we checked in, the front desk staff gave us a late check out till 1pm when the originally time was 11am. Because of the late checkout, my friend and I were able to check out Harvard in the late morning and came back to the hotel around 12noon. When we tried to go into our room using our room card, we were locked out. However, our other friends from the other room had no trouble and were able to go into their room using their room card. My friend and I head to front desk for assistance and informed them of our trouble. We informed them that we had a late check out till 1pm and that our room card was not working. The lady who was managing the front desk was not friendly towards us and told us that we were supposed to come down to the front desk at 11am to have our cards extended if we have a late check out. However, that does not make sense because our friends from the other room (who also had a late check out) was able to use their card without any trouble. Next, we enquired whether it was possible for them to extend our card for us so that we can open the room and get our luggage for checkout and they say that they were unable to do so. This is because the room was not checked in under our names. One of our friends checked in both rooms on our behalf and she happened to be out for lunch and not back yet. Because of that, the front desk lady said that she was not allowed to open the doors for us because the room was not registered under our names. We told us her our friend registered BOTH rooms under her name because she was making payment with her credit card. We understand that they were unable to open the door for us due to security reasons but the tone in which the lady spoke to us was very unfriendly. She was professional about it but we felt that she did not provide us with any suggestions on what we can do. All she told us was that we cannot go into the room and she did not offer any other solutions for us. In the end, she consulted her supervisor and after more explanations, the supervisor gave us new room cards and allowed us to enter the rooms. We understand that the hotel has their own room security regulations and we respect that. However, we felt that the front desk staff can be more friendly and provide solutions to the guests. We felt frustrated after the incident and it was not a nice ending to our first trip to Boston. Because of this, we might not consider staying at Doubletree Boston again in future even though they have beautiful rooms.

Reviews.Title: “kind of weird”
Reviews.Author: evjolin
Reviews.Content: loved the bed--super comfortable (we actually over-slept for father's day brunch....ooops!) the room was clearly newly furnished, but furniture is this bizarre looking traditional style but with asian hardware to make it look contemporary. i am in the design business so am super attentive to that, but my husband agreed....odd. also, in room refrigerator has a large scrolling digital screen that glows bright green at night. i like a dark room and that drove me crazy as i was trying to fall asleep. bathroom was in need of some re-caulking, counter was acrylic (vs. granite or marble) overall the room wasn't as nice as another 3 star we stayed in the previous night. and the parking situation....they have a teensy tiny drop off/pick up area that is a total disaster. the attendants do not speak english well and are very difficult to interpret. also, the area is so small with only one exit/entrance area that cars are constantly getting blocked in by other cars. disastrous and frustrating!

Reviews.Title: “I always stay here when in Boston”
Reviews.Author: JBIndianapolis
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a conference at the Taj, but I had stayed here at the Doubletree before, and knew it was fairly close by and about half the price of the Taj. I'm not sure what you get at the Taj for the extra $200 per night, but I was happy to stay here and walk 15 minutes each way through the theater district and the scenic Public Garden. The restaurant is great for a quick breakfast on the way out the door. The close proximity to the T station next door makes it an excellent base from which to go almost anywhere in the Boston metro area without a car - including the airport. The room was up to date, clean and very comfortable. I really like the free use of the facilities of the Y next door - far more extensive than the typical small exercize room in even a five star hotel. I could actually swim laps in a regulation pool. This place has everything I would ever need or want in a hotel, and some features that very few others have. I see no point in ever staying anywhere else in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: JackMcCTraveler
Reviews.Content: With the exception of the staff who assisted us with the valet parking, the employees were unpleasant and rude. The non-smoking room smelled as though it had recently been converted from a smoking room and that some effort had been made to mask the smoke. The room was small, though clean. I would not stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Mother's Day getaway”
Reviews.Author: wv73
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Doubletree over Mother's day weekend. Booked thru Hilton Honors Website for 209.00/night. Good price for Boston--loved the fact the "T' is literally 150 ft. from the hotel door. Room was clean, comfy bed and pillows. Buffet Breakfast was fine as was room service for am dining. Staff was helpful. Will definitely stay there again. For aiport connection, in my opinion, it is easier to get to the airport using the Orange(T service next to Hotel) and then transferring to Blue Line than using Siver Line. Never noticed any noise from the Med Center across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Doubletree!”
Reviews.Author: lilmm
Reviews.Content: I booked this on Priceline and got it for about $80-90 per night for three nights at the beginning of May. I really like the location, it is right next to a major hospital and right next to a T-stop (metro stop.) But we could walk all the way to the freedom trail and beacon hill district, although it is in the theater district it was not veyr far. I enjoyed the location although some people said in previous reviews it is a little "shady" we did not think so at all. The hotel definitely met and exceeded expectations for a priceline booking. The receptionist was friendly and at first said we have a smoking room and I asked if it is possible to change, she left and in about 10 minutes came back and said we can change to non-smoking, which was really great. We got a free cookie on check-in which is usual with Doubletrees. They also gave us an extremely useful map and magazine with info that we used extensively during our stay for finding attractions. They made some mistake in charging a minibar item which we didnt' use but they corrected it immediately. This happens at a lot of hotels though so it must be watched out for. We didn't have a car but parking was around 20-30 dollars if I remember right. Also, it was about $30 for a taxi from the airport, but one could have also taken the T as it goes directly from the aiport and only one transfer is required. This is only $2/person. (We opted for the taxi because of our suitcase) We didn't try the breakfast becuase it was around $10-15 a person and this is expensive for a continental breakfast. Instead I got a delicious whole-wheat poppy seed bagel with lox and a coffee for about $5 at a nearby Finangle-a-Bagel (nearby as in, by the freedom trail where we walked to). There are also a lot of Dunkin Donuts around where my husband ate at for breakfast since he doesn't like bagels No complaints! (although, I would only get it thru priceline, it seems a little pricey otherwise)

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Chic - Good experience”
Reviews.Author: FrequentBizTraveler
Reviews.Content: I must admit I do not usually book at Doubletrees because I find them to be highly inconsistent. This property was a very pleasant surprise. Got a great rate on Priceline. The hotel has been completely renovated in a very "asian-chic" style. Friendly reception by the doorman and front desk. Nice bar in the lobby which was well-patronized. Good location, although it is a bit outside the heart of downtown. My only issues: They tried to book me in a smoking room (although I had requested non-smoking), telling me that my non-smoking preference was not guaranteed. After I refused a smoking room, they were able to find a non-smoking one for me. Also, the floors in the room must be wood under the carpet, as they were quite squeaky. The room itself was bright, clean and new.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be scared of the Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: callieq
Reviews.Content: Enough about the "scary" location of this hotel. Just remember, you are in a city, and like every city, one must be aware. The Doubletree was a great stay this past weekend. We checked in around noon and received our yummy cookies. We had a room on the 3rd floor facing the hospital. (For the record, we heard only 1 siren the entire time we were there.) The room was pretty large, king bed, big windows, fridge, mini bar, desk, no tub, just shower, neutrogena toilet trees in bathroom also. The pool and gym are in the connected YMCA. Just because it wasn't in hotel, it wasn't a burden at all. The lounge has a bar that sits maybe 15. Location.... again, I repeat DO NOT BE HESITANT on booking this hotel. I actually liked the location. Close to Jacob Wirths one of the oldest pubs in Boston. Down the street from Filenes Basement and Downtown Crossings. Shopping everywhere. The Boston Commons (park) was close also. Bring your ice skates in case you want to try the rink. Restaurants everywhere. You name the type of food, and it would be a 3-10 min walk to get there. The service and people at the hotel was great. Absolutely no complaints. Hilton/ Doubletree is a good name and a solid choice when you come to Beantown. Lastly, the weekend that we went every other hotel in the city was well over $200.00, not here.... less than $200. Booked through hotel via. phone. Have a great trip. Boston is the best!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LOLOLOLOLO43
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in Oct 07 with my Dad and 19 month old daughter. We found it a great hotel we had read bad reviews about location etc but this is far from the truth- 5 min walk to down town and the T station practically in the car park of hotel. We never once felt in danger as other reviews had stated. The service was great eg asked at reception if they could heat baby food for me and they sent a microwave to our room!!Great stay and would recommend it without a doubt

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Mostly”
Reviews.Author: milkyway4679
Reviews.Content: Our hotel stay had several problems from the start. Disappointingly, we did not receive our promised complimentary cookies upon check-in, which is not a big deal, but when we saw other guests receiving them, we felt as though we were being treated badly. We were treated rudely, and there was no effort made to make things easier for us. During our stay, the staff was of little help is numerous areas, and with many of them having strong accents, it was hard to understand what they were saying. The rooms are nice, and the hotel is in a somewhat unsafe area, but only at night must one be concerned. I was overall disappointed in our treatment and will not be recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: hoteltravel411
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the DoubleTree (821 Washington Street, Boston) for one night on Oct 6. We were very pleased with our stay. The room was very clean and had high ceilings and wonderful bed. We returned late to the hotel that evening and were very hungry. The bartender got an appetizer order in for us just before the kitchen closed. It was so nice of him (and the kitchen) we really appreciated it. Great service at the front desk and the valets too. We were overall very, very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: e30ygc
Reviews.Content: Room was very clean, location is excellent, only 2minutes walking to New England Medical Center subway station. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Boston Trip”
Reviews.Author: Trav082501
Reviews.Content: Good time in Boston. Everyone was nice. We were surprised to see the hotel wanted $12.95 for the breakfast buffet. It was too much especially with so many diners in the area for breakfast. Overall was a nice hotel. Comfortable beds, nice and quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Ladycage
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doubletree Downtown Boston this past Labor Day weekend and I was extremely pleased with the hotel. After reading some of the reviews I had my doubts and I even reserved a room at the Hilton Logan airport for the next night just in case I didn't like this hotel. I arrived Thursday morning and called the hotel to notify them that I had arrived and see if I could check in earlier, it was 10:00 am, they said sure come in. When I arrived about 10:40 am, I was told that they had one smoking king room available, I actually booked a smoking king room because that was all they had at the time of my booking but I really wanted a non-smoking room. I was advised that I could check-in into the smoking room now and if I thought it was too bad come back around 3:00pm to see if any non smoking came available. I checked in and went up to room 301, the room had only a very slight hint of smoke but wasn't bad but the room kinda small. I checked out the bathroom and it was big and clean, but since the room was small I called the front desk to ask for another room, they advised me to wait until 3:00pm so I left my things in the room and went exploring downtown crossing. I got back at exactly 3pm and went to the front desk to change my room, I was told that only one non smoking king was available 621 so I took it. Went up to the room and the business center is right down from it, the room was clean and a very nice size much much bigger than the one on the 3rd floor. I had requested a microwave for $5 extra/night and it was on top of the small table with the coffe maker and cups, next to that was a desk and a computer chair. There was 27in TV, in the closet were sleepers and a terry cloth robe. The bathroom in this room was small compared to the one on 3rd floor but it was big enough. I was very happy with this room, the bed was extremely comfortable with many pillows. The staff was very helpful and go out of there way to make you comfortable. The hotel is right at the Orange Line was transportation was so easy. The neighborhood was fine, I walked around at night without any problems, McDonalds and Chinatown are one block away. New England Medical Center and AuBonPain are right across the street. I will be staying here again. The cookies each evening they have a so good.

Reviews.Title: “So much better than I was led to expect by some of the reviews”
Reviews.Author: Holidayworrier25
Reviews.Content: Like the last reviewer I was really worried about going to the Doubletree after reading some previous reviews about safety. Me and my husband went to Boston with our 3 teenage daughters and the concern about the area this hotel is in is so totally unfounded. We walked around the area at night when coming back after dinner and it was quiet and peaceful, clean and well lit. I was not worried at all and if you are reading this review then should be totally relaxed about your safety. The T stop was right nearby and so it was easy to get to anywhere. And you could walk easily too. The concierge in the hotel were outstanding - we kept asking them questions and it was never too much trouble for them. They booked tours for us on the trolley buses which you can get on and off around the city and they did a telephone booking for us for the whale watch trip which our girls loved - we saw humpback whales. The hotel was extremely clean (and I am really fussy!) and the beds were the best I have ever slept in. Our rooms were at the back of the courtyard so we didn't have any noise at all. Yes there is no view but surely no one can expect a view in a city hotel?!! You are surrounded by buildings of course!! All in all we had a great time in a very comfortable hotel in a perfect area for sightseeing and we were very grateful to the concierge for all their help in making our visit so easy and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, slightly scary location.”
Reviews.Author: PickE
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money at this hotel, considering its in "downtown" boston. First off, the lobby and rooms are impeccably clean and new, the beds are comfy and the bathroom clean and shiny. I was surprised the hotel looked this good for a doubletree, but i think its new. Probabaly a great place to stay with a family too. No complaints about the hotel, but the location might be a put off, especially at night. The location is near the major Tufts hospital, but lands in between the no man zone of the scary at night downtown crossing and the nobody is there after 10pm chinatown. Would not feel comfortable walking around at night trying to get back to the hotel, especially if a female. The staff at the hotel are good, they do their job, nothing more or less.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: delaware9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from a Friday to Sunday and had a great time. We got a great price of $100 per night on Priceline. The hotel is in a great location, I thought. We bought a $15 public transportation pass which was good for an entire week, though we were only there for 3 days. This was all we used to get around. You can get to this hotel via the airport bus and subway, and the train stop is so close to the hotel. Boston Common is a couple of blocks away, and we started our Freedom Trail walk there. As far as what people said about the neighborhood, I did not find it to be unsafe. Certainly one should be cautious in a major city, but we walked back to the hotel at 9 pm on Friday and 11:30 pm on Saturday, and we were fine. Be aware that wireless is $10 for your stay, but they have some computers near the front desk that you can use for a free, quick email check. We did not get the famous cookies, but that is probably because we checked in at about 10 am, which I will certainly not complain about! We were going to give our bags to the concierge and explore the city, but he said we should try to check in early, and it was fine. For some reason, our reservation was listed as Smoking, which we did not want, but they changed it right away. All in all, we really enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “great stay but noisy at night”
Reviews.Author: agac
Reviews.Content: Stayed here memorial day weekend. Obtained a suite for $175, on the hotel website. I had concerns about the location, but this dissapeared within minutes of our arrival. The hotel is within a 10-20 minute walk from the historic centre. We walked everyday and felt safe. The NE medical T stop, is metres away. Chinatown and all its great restaurants was just a 5 minute walk away. The suite was very clean. The restroom is due for an overhaul. The bed was extremely comfortable. The suite had a fridge and sink. The staff was very pleasant and friendly. My biggest complainant, which has been raised in other reviews is the noise at night. We had a room facing the parking lot. There is a nightclub nearby and everyone is yelling and screaming at 2am, and engines are reving, I felt sorry for the people who live in the retirement home accross the street. I would recomend this hotel, but try to get a room that does not face the parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Got our rooms on Priceline....and got priceline rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Freethinnker
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 went college viewing in March. I was surprised at the high cost of rooms in Boston, so I hunted for bargain rates. This was my first time using Priceline and I was pleased with their process. We wanted a hotel on the subway line as we did not plan to rent a car. That worked out great - we got on the subway at the airport, switched lines once I think, then got off less than one block from the hotel. The location of this hotel was perfect - in the downtown area, next to Chinatown and the theater district. We got our rooms for 89.00 each, when most rooms go for more than double that AT LEAST. Here's what you get for the priceline rate - one room was on the 2nd floor directly facing the emergency room of the hospital acroos the street, so yes - there was plenty of noise from sirens. The second room had a lovely view....of a storage room containing folding beds! Seriously - it had a huge window with drapes that looked into a room. Needless to say, those drapes were kept closed. That was our teenagers room, and they were disappointed to have NO view. It snowed during our visit, so they had to come into our room to see the parking lot getting snowy! The rooms were small, clean, and suited our purpose. We did not eat at the hotel, the kids did use the adjoining YMCA and enjoyed that. Across the street in the hospital is an Au Bon Pain restaurant where we atre breakfast most days. We were unable to move our rooms as the front desk told us they were full (we went the week before St. Patty's weekend) but, I think they had rooms as it was NOT busy in the lobby EVER. I think that they have designated "crummy" rooms for the low Priceline rates. All in all, we were pleased with what we got for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel....Not a great location”
Reviews.Author: ARKSugarLand
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok...neat and clean, nothing fancy. I could live with that, but I was afraid I wouldn't live walking around in the immediate neighborhood.! The folks at hotel said it was safe and off I went. It is dark and dreary and very dangerous feeling in the chinatown area at night. I was only stayin at hotel one night until I could get in the one I had booked for the remainder of the trip. Later in the week I mentioned to a police officer how nervous I was walking there at night, he said FOR GOOD REASON!...Used to be known as Battle Zone...still is in many ways. No Way should a woman alone walk anywhere from there at night. Hotel needs to let people know this. It was also across street from hospital emergency room and sirens going all night. Oh, well. At least it was just one night and I got out of there as soon as I could next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYC-Canuck
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night - I had to do a quick overnight in Boston for an early meeting the next day. Check In: Arrived at 9pm, the check in was friendly, quick and efficient. Doubletree's "signature" is to give you a warm, chocolate chip cookie at check in. Room: average size. very clean. see pics. Only problem was tv would not work, someone had unplugged it behind the entertainment center. Since I do not have Herculean strength I called for them to fix it and they came up right away. Bed was comfortable Bath: Below Average. Limited toiletries but more available if you call down for them. No bathrobes. Bathroom needs some minor fixes - caulking around the tub, some stained ceiling tiles, air vent was very noisy. Shower head was not tall enough. I'm 5'10" and it did not come above my head. Internet: wireless available in room for $9.95 per day I did not eat in the hotel or use their fitness room. Check Out: Did quick check out. efficient. Taxis: Waiting outside the hotel in the morning. $5 to train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: coremember
Reviews.Content: Just got back from four days at the doubletree. We had three rooms and they were ready when we arrived from the red eye flight from Oakland. We got to the hotel around 8 in the morning and we checked in right away. The staff were all friendly and the accomodations were clean. The bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I had ever slept. We didnt eat at the resaurant, the breakfast buffet was 12 dollars. Access was very easy, the subway station is about 50 yards from the hotel. I would definately stay there again and would recommend this to anyone. The hotel is close to Boston Common and lots of touristy spots.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: StewC
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 5 day city break to Boston and stayed at this hotel. Got a great deal on Priceline and was glad we stayed here. Reception staff polite and helpful and rooms were spotless and beds so comfortable. Excellent choice of cable channels and turn down service. Located right next to T station and walking distance to Chinatown and Boston Common. Thoroughly recommend this hotel and would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, OK location”
Reviews.Author: ElizBC
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice, and were very happy both times. We lived in Boston for 7 years, so we know the area, but it is a bit of an odd location for tourists. It's connected to New England Medical Center and near the Theatre district. It's also on the edge of Chinatown, and is not necessarily the safest part of town at night. There are many other hotels in the back bay area in a "better" part of town, but this one has a great price and pleasant staff. One time we stayed there was for our wedding anniversary and the front desk upgraded us to a suite! Oh, and they have yummy warm cookies on check-in!:) Overall, I do highly recommend this hotel, just maybe take a cab back at the end of the night. If you were to stay at the Westin or the Ritz or Jury's, you'd be in a better, fancier part of town and closer to shops, but you'd pay triple the price! And really, Boston's not that big - you can be at those places after a pleasant 10 minute walk! Hint: We have twice tried priceline for $100 in the downtown/charlestown area, and twice we got this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: TarheelsInNj
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel, in large part for its great location right by Chinatown and the Theatre District. It was an easy walk to Boston Common, the Freedom Trail, and many shopping options. We were also pleasantly surprised to find that Quincy Market, the North End, Beacon Hill, and Back Bay were only a 15- 20 minute walk (though in opposite directions!) There is a T-stop right next to the property for longer distances, or if you're not up for walking. The room was beautiful, clean, and very spacious (including the bathroom). The lobby and exterior were also very nice, and the front desk staff was helpful and courteous. Though the parking was expensive at the hotel, there were several garages close by that offered weekend specials. All in all, we had a great 3-night stay, and would definitely stay at the Doubletree again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Theatre”
Reviews.Author: aedrbf
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of it's proximity to the theatre district. It is located next to the New England Medical Center, on the border of Chinatown, has an Orange Line T stop next door, valet parking and you easily walk to all theatre and many restaurants. It is a good location for downtown. I recommned this hotel and would stay there again. We had no problems walking to and from theatre late at night on a Saturday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rbsimmo
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel located right in the heart of Boston. 5 min walk any direction to sightseeing attractions. It is located opposite a huge busy hospital. we wer on the 3rd floor and were woken a couple of times by the sirens at night. If you stay here ask to be on a higher floor at the back of the hotel as the hospital is at the front end. Bathrooms were large with good pressure in the shower. there is a king size bed which was very comfy. There is a bar fridge in the room but be warned. Don't even think about even lifting an item out of it unless you are going to eat or drink it as it will be charged immediatley to your room. This goes for any item you think you can replace back in there. You will be billed twice for this item. There must be sensors in the fridge itself that registers when an item is removed . The warm choc chip cookie on arriavl is anice touch and tastes great too. If we were to visit Boston again we would probably stay here again but ask for a room at the back of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kiki_noda
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had reservations for a 4-Nights stay booked through the NETDIRECT Rates on the Doubletree website. We arrived in November 18th and we were a couple of hours early to check-in. Our room was already ready and they gave us their traditional cookie (the best cookie ever!). The room was pretty big for two people and the bathroom was always clean. One night we took a chocolate bar from the minifridge and they charged us for 2, but after we complained, they immediately corrected the bill. We had other problem during checkout (they charged us 250.00 more than we expected), but it was solved too. The hotel is seconds away from the subway stop (Orange Line - NE Medical Center), but we barely used it because you can walk for almost all the attractions in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: joannemcevoy13
Reviews.Content: I arrived with my husband (honeymoon) after spending 5 nights in New York. During check-in at the hotel I was asked the purpose of my stay in Boston. I informed reception that I was on honeymoon. They upgraded my room. The room was very spacious, a king-size bed (the biggest I've ever seen!!!), and spacious ensuite. It was immaculately presented, and had a mini-bar to boot. Due to extortionate prices we didn't partake, but at least we had the option. The hotel is a 1min walk to Boston's subway system, called 'the T'. It is also a 3 min walk to Boston common, so the location was unbelievable. Boston in general was good, but there were alot of beggers on the streets, both day and night, and they were persistent in accosting you for money. One guy even threw away the coins that I gave him because it didn't amount to much. That did give me a laugh, he showed ambition. The service in the hotel was great, everyone was very friendly and helpful, and the room was great.

Reviews.Title: “Easy going”
Reviews.Author: teake
Reviews.Content: I had to stay over for two nights in Boston on a weekend in September to bridge meetings in two adjacent weeks, one in New York and one in Massachusetts. The reception area and front desk was quite large and several receptionists were helping the new arrivals. It wasn't very formal and stylish, rather easy going and quick. The sofas in the lobby area were mostly occupied with younger people, probably students (?). The impression of openness continued in the stairway area and lifts. The lifts were not closed compartments, because the back side was all glass revealing a view on the central stairway and a pseudo-garden at the lobby floor. Rooms and bathroom, were clean, bright and pleasant. I did not detect noise from outside the building during the day or night. The room had fast internet access that had to be activated at the front desk first. Adjacent to the lobby there were one or two small rooms that had computers in them with internet access (I think they could be used for free) and they were regularly used. Service in the dining room wasn't very stylish nor formal. It made the impression on me that is was seen as something on the side ... something of minor importance. Food was good though. I wasn't very happy with the breakfast, to a large part because I'm very hard to please when it comes to the first meal of the day. It didn't had the variety that I'm used to from the Short Hills Hilton, but quality was fine. I liked the fact that the Double was in walking distance of attractive, easy going shops and museums and I visited the Boston Aquarium which was only 20 minutes away by foot. All in all I liked the hotel and will certainly consider to stay there again when the occasion occurs.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy on the weekends!!!”
Reviews.Author: thebenns
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location within walking distance of a lot of things. We were able to walk to Legal Sea Foods and the Charles St. Playhouse for a show. The location near the T is really great too, we had no problem getting around Boston and Cambridge without a car. The hotel is also really cool, the renovations kept a lot of the schoolhouse details, and the beds and linens are really modern and comfortable. Our only major problem (and it was MAJOR) was that on both Saturday and Sunday nights (we stayed on a holiday weekend) there was unbearable noise coming from the huge parking garage next door from 2-3 am when everyone was coming out of the bars. People were honking their horns and yelling for at least an hour because it would take that long to empty the garage, and it kept us up no matter how hard we tried to ignore it. I would not go back to this hotel on a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Cookies on arrival”
Reviews.Author: Annabananabaloo
Reviews.Content: Checked in after a long flight from Vegas, and found the hotel very easily as there is an underground stop just down the road. The guy on reception was extremely nice and helpful - and the cookies on arrival were wonderful. Very comfortable room that was clean. Bar man gave great service too (and a second free cookie), and the breakfast was top notch (although service then was a little disapointing. The concierge/porter was also a great help, and always had a smile on our way in and out of the hotel. Has the slowest lift in the whole world, but this did not stop us enjoying this hotel - would definately stay there again if in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Maine-ahh
Reviews.Content: We booked a free weekend using points. The directions to the hotel were not very good, as there is actually an Orange Line station less than 100 feet away, but they do not mention it. We had to wait a long time for check in, because our adjacent rooms were not cleaned yet. It was actually about 3:30PM when they were finally ready. So, we went next door to try the "Olympic size" pool. What a JOKE! This pool is not even HALF Olympic size, and ALL SWIMMERS must wear a bathing cap. This is inside the Chinatown YMCA and most of the signage was in Chinese which was interesting. Howver, the pool was very disappointing as I booked this hotel based on the pool, which my kids were excited to try. The hotel has a strange layout, with crooked hallways that wind around many corners. The rooms are small. The insulation is also not very good as you can hear every sink, shower and toilet running whether next to the room or above it. We ate at the Wisteria Restaurant one night, and the first words from the waiter to every diner were "I'm sorry!" because he was trying to handle 10+ tables averaging four people each. I waited over 20 minutes for my check after asking for it several times. Typical hotel food - overpriced and bland. We also had breakfast at the Vines Cafe one morning. It is basically a small coffee shop with pre-packaged fruit cups, coffee, muffins and boxes of cereal. We will never stay here again, but use our points for a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a try...”
Reviews.Author: CTUSA
Reviews.Content: New hotel, up to Hilton standards, Enjoyed the fresh cookie upon check-in, enjoyed the bar and snacks in the late night.... Good breakfast buffet. Give it a shot. Rooms were very clean and tastefully decorated. A nice new addition to the theatre district in the Beantown.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good size room, nightly rate is what sold us”
Reviews.Author: CaliGirl22
Reviews.Content: First trip to Boston, stayed three nights at the Doubletree. Hotel is very nice and clean. Rooms are an ok size (had a king bed room), bathrooms are nice size. No refrigerator except the mini bar which you can't open or you get charged $5 for a coke. Front desk staff is over-worked, not terribly rude but not overly nice. Housekeeping is on their own schedule- called three times because they cleaned the room and did not leave towels. Finally after four hours called the front desk & someone brought them up. Beds not so comfortable, bath towels could use a little fabric softener. The linens have been bleached too many times, bring your own pillowcase and bath towels! They started ripping up the hallway carpet early in the morning, and then asked to come into our room to tear up the carpet by our door. It would have been nice if they let us know this upon check-in, as my boyfriend had the stomach flu. Internet is not free. The second floor has two free interenet computers- don't plan on checking in with your airline and printing your boarding pass because the computers dont have the right programs installed. Room service is by far the best thing about the hotel. It is not too pricey, and arrives quick. Oh yes, and the courtyard view lessens the street noise. The location could have been a tiny bit better, right next to the hospital you hear sirens all night, plus its a good walk to all the great things in Boston. But was never afraid walking to the hotel at night. Overall, the hotel is nice and you will feel like you stayed at a nice place. The service could have been friendly, especially the concierge, who was nice but seemed put out by questions. The room rate would have to be the lowest in town for me to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “friendly but shambolic”
Reviews.Author: chesterimp
Reviews.Content: Good location, if a bit seedy in places; Downtown/freedom trail/Boston common walkable or use T-station adjacent. Staff friendly and helpful, although the underlying impression was that things were slightly out of control. However:- We booked a no-smoking room, which we didn't get and couldn't transfer, and ended up with an 'ozone' machine in it. Room was small and gloomy, only just accommodated the roll-away bed we needed for 2nd teenage son. Bathroom was huge, suggests architects (or their brief) got it wrong. Corridors tired and grubby tho' seems this is being improved. Restaurant expensive for breakfast & dinner; good alternatives nearby ('Bon Pain' at the hospital for breakfast, great pun?), and on edge of Chinatown for dinner. Liked the cookies, but too many of these frills without getting the basics right is not what it is about.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location & reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: HOaKIE
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Boston Doubletree on Washington Street. It's on the outskirts of Chinatown and within walking distance of all the historic Boston attractions. The rooms were very nice. The hotel was recently renovated. The staff was first class. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently went on a trip to Boston and we stayed in the Doubltree. We were greeted warmly when we first arrived with a warm chocolate chip cookie for each of us. Our room was located in a far wing of the hotel. Although it was quite a walk to get there, it was virtually silent at night. All of the hotels services we enjoyed. The restaurant in the lobby is very nice, the staff are very friendly and the rooms are very nice. Another nice thing is that all hotel guests can use the YMCA downstairs for free. The only thing that we didn't like about this hotel was the location. It is located right across from a hospital. We didn't hear much noise, but the neighbourhood was kind of rough. It was, though, located close to the Boston Common and only a few blocks away from some very nice neighbourhoods. I would recommend this hotel to families and those who don't plan to spend a lot of time around the hotels neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: East Yorkshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Boston for 4 nights. We were there for July 4th. What a wonderful Hotel. Everybody was great. There was a restaurant you could have breakfast & evening meal.. The buffet breakfast was $12 but was well worth it. There is a snackbar attached. We found there were very few places to have breakfast in Boston. Having been to New York we just assumed it would be as easy. A great Hotel & not far from sights.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: amandatx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over the 4th of July holiday weekend. The hotel is in the Chinatown/Med Center area but is convenient by walking, the T or by cab to much of what we needed to do and see in Boston. The parking is a little scarce and expensive but we did not have a car. We were in a corner room on the 6th floor that was pretty spacious, although not huge. The bathroom was nicely appointed and clean. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room was clean. The lobby and bar area never felt cramped and service, for the most part, was friendly and efficient. The only negatives were that the elevator can be extremely slow. The hotel is also designed differently than I have ever seen before....it almost reminded me of more of a medical building's hallways rather than a hotel. The hallways were lined in a yellow leather-like material and it felt very cozy. All in all, a good stay. At $150 over the holiday weekend, a great bargain and location!

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: maisany
Reviews.Content: The NE Medical Center T station was literally 20 yards from the front door, making my daily commute to the Seaport Hotel very easy. I think the front desk staff is over-extended, but luckily, I didn't require too much service from them. For some reason, I had difficulty accessing my company network via the VPN from this hotel, but I managed to work around it. I had a "junior suite", which was a good sized room, but other than it's size, really didn't have much else to recommend it. It was at the far end of the hall from the elevator/stairs (the elevators were extremely slow so being on the second floor, I took the stairs most of the time), and I had a view out of my window of the rear parking lot with dumpsters filled with old boxsprings the entire time. You're not taking this room for the romantic view. The neighborhood is a bit run-down also, but nothing that I would be overly concerned about. There are several decent restaurants within walking distance, and as I indicated, the T is very close by so you can get to pretty much anywhere within the city via the transit system.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but wasn't worth $200/night”
Reviews.Author: tripgurl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family for one night and although it was close to transportation, chinatown, and attractions; the service wasn't good. The front desk wasn't very nice and the room was tiny. Parking was $40 (i think) per day, which is outrageous for outdoor parking!!! There are better hotels for less in Boston, do not waste your time here.

Reviews.Title: “Inflexible Management”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This review is regarding a completely inflexible room cancellation policy. If you intend to use this hotel, you better make sure you arrive! If you don't cancel 24 hours in advance, they will most certainly charge you the FULL ROOM AND TAX amount! I'm an Executive Assistant, who occasionally has had to cancel rooms at hotels because of changes in meeting plans and NEVER, has a hotel (or at least better ones) not worked with me. I had to cancel 2 rooms with Doubletree and called at 9AM (check in isn't until 3PM) I was told that I would be FULLY CHARGED. I asked if they would at least waive one of the room charges or give me a partial credit toward a future booking- they said no. Then I called the main Guest Services number and got the same response because, even though the representative felt this was inflexible. He said the hotel was franchised and made a call on my behalf and still, no flexibility. With all of the many hotel choices that are available.. I urge you to STAY AWAY FROM DOUBLETREE! They haven't got a clue about how to handle and satisfy customers and seem to have absolutely no problem taking full amounts of room fees from guests who never stepped foot in their hotel. THIS IS SHABBY SERVICE AND I WILL NEVER BOOK OR RECOMMEND A DOUBLETREE HOTEL TO ANYONE! (Nor Hilton- because they are connected).

Reviews.Title: “Great Doubletree hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Boston for 4 nights at the beginning of March. Arrived about 2.30 pm, and my room was ready, although check in wasn't until 3. Was greeted with a warm chocolate chip cookie that went down a treat. All the staff that i met were pleasent and professional. Had a massive room with 2 double beds, even though i was a lone traveller. Found the hotel was in a central location and that you can to get to all the major attractions by foot. The subway was extremely handy and right next door to the hotel. This hotel is easy to get to from and too the airport and only cost $1.25. Would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not that impressed”
Reviews.Author: brian796
Reviews.Content: So maybe the problems I encountered were unusual, but during a recent 1-night stay I was not very impressed with the hotel. First, the good. It's in the southern edge of downtown, so you can walk to many of Boston's downtown attractions in about 20 minutes. The lobby was not bad. It is connected to a YMCA where you can go play basketball, workout, jog on a small outdoor track, etc. Problems... The high-speed Internet was broken (as confirmed by the front desk) and both elevators were broken on the morning of checkout (eg- everyone had to lug their luggage down the stairs). Finally, the room was small and provided no view (window faced a wall).

Reviews.Title: “Boston in the winter...”
Reviews.Author: Trevorw38
Reviews.Content: The Doubletreee was a new hotel for me - using my girlfriend's Hilton points I had not expected much from a "free" stay but was pleasantly surprised by the hotel. Location was convenient - immediate vicinity of Boston Common, Chinatown and the theatre district and with a T line stop next door easy to travel throughout the city (or to get a cab outside). It was next to a hospital and effectively one block from shops/offices but that did not bother us - and early on a Saturday morning when I went out to get a coffee at 7am there were some strange characters about which made me uncomfortable (but there again I guess that is the same in any big city?) The staff were welcoming, the warm cookie given at check in a pleasure especially in the cold weather. The room was clean, comfortable and spacious. Staff were knowledgeable, the concierge had a list of local restaurants and we slept well on a nice large bed! Downside? Well, by comparison this is not the Boston Harbor Hotel in terms of facilities - you have to go next door if you want a swim and there's no view of the harbour. There again the rates are much cheaper! I personally prefer the Omni Parker but would rate this better than the Wyndham, Colonnade or Swissotel - or the Charles Street Inn We visit Boston regularly, usually two or three times a year. We love the city and rate this hotel - the Thai restaurant nearby was fine, nothing special but reasonable. The North End was as ever great fun and plenty of good places to eat and enjoy Italian food. Went to the Aquarium - terrific way to spend an hour or two! And if you get time, head up to the White Mountains and the Inn at Thorn Hill in Jackson, New Hampshire or the Camden Maine Stay in Camden, Maine!

Reviews.Title: “Another great experience!”
Reviews.Author: IrishDawn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at this hotel three times during weekend excursions to Boston. Each time I have been amazed at the amenities and service they deliver for such a reasonable price. The service, from check-in to housekeeping to the bellmen, is exemplary. Everyone goes above and beyond to make the guests happy. Each room we have stayed in has been spotless. On this trip the hotel gave us free breakfast coupons, even though our rate did not include them. The location, practically on top of the TNEMC station on Boston's Orange Line, makes navigating the city very easy. It is also within steps of all the theater district's venues and a short walk from the best restaurants in Boston's Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaisyLNorthDakota
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night here and it was a very good experience. The room was airy, big, and clean. I especially liked the feng shui influences in the hotel. Excellent location. You're walking distance from Chinatown and the theatre district. The staff was professional and friendly. Some people might not like to hear sirens during the night. It didn't bother me. I would definitely stay at the Doubletree again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended If You Use Public Transit”
Reviews.Author: turkeyvote
Reviews.Content: The Downtown Doubletree is a great place to stay in Boston if you use public transit. The T stop is practically next door (NE Med Center stop - $1.25 to the airport with one transfer). We used the T extensively and found it old, but reliable and safe - even at night. With such easy, inexpensive transit access, the Doubletree's location made our trip a pleasure. We spent 6 nights at this hotel in June 2005. The service was always quick & polite. There is an elevator around the stairs mentioned by another reviewer. The beds were very comfortable and our room with 2 queen beds was spacious enough for 2 adults & 2 teenagers. We did not eat at the hotel, but found the chain Le Bon Pain across the street to be a great place to pick up coffee & breakfast on our way out for the day. They charge for "extras": internet access is very expensive, the stocked mini fridge in the room has prices that have to some kind of joke - $3.50 for a Coke that goes for $1.50 down the hall by the ice machine, and they even charge daily to use the in room safe. But if you can do without those frills, this is a great place to stay. Very nice, very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “close to everything”
Reviews.Author: potcake62
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for one night only,we had a cruise to catch the next day.The hotel itself is nice and the staff are very nice especially Reggie the doorman.The only problems we had were that the hotel had a long flight of stairs to climb with no guest elevator, and we ran into some rowdy punks while out walking to dinner,but there were a lot of other people out walking so we still felt safe.We had one more problem that has nothing to do wiyh the hotel.There were 4 of us and a lot of luggage for a 10 day cruise and we had problems getting a taxi to carry us to the port.We had to wait well over a hour to try to find a van.We only found one because he pulled up to drop someone off.I would reccommend if you have a large group to make arrangements ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Good location in the theatre district”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights in April, 2005. The hotel is in the theatre district which is a good location if you are going to see a play/show. It's a good walk to Quincy Market, the waterfront or any of the major attractions, so if theatre is not your focus you may want to look elsewhere. The rooms are of adequate size - not the usual 2 room suites that Doubletree is known for. A prior review stated that first floor rooms are noisy and that is definitely true. We stayed in room 124 which faced a parking lot and was loud all night long until about 5 in the morning. Valet parking is a whopping $32 a night and is your only choice unless you find a parking lot near the hotel. The breakfast buffet was gross, so forego that and walk to nearby restaurants for half the price. The concierge was great and recommended a wonderful Italian restaurant in the North End for our last night's stay - Piccolo Nido. It doesn't look like much from the street but the food was excellent. Overall - not a bad choice but nothing to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree well-located”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Woo
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at the Doubletree Hotel, Washington St, Boston in mid-January. It is located near Chinatown and the New England Medical Center. Accommodations were clean and comfortable. What I liked most was that Tremont St, Boylston St, the Boston Common were all within easy walking distance. Good restaurants are also easily accessible.
